loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, William has been working hard to manage his welding business, which does widows and doors. 

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more machine spare parts to be used in his welding business, help William generate greater profits, and improve his family's standard of living. William hopes that in the future, he will be able to build more rental houses. 

William is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like William, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but they have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more machine spare parts to be used for his welding business

loans.name: Ayinkè Moubachiratou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du groupe du nom d'Ayinke Moubachiratou est mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle a un niveau d'instruction primaire. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, Ayinkè Moubachiratou mène comme activité la vente des articles de quincaillerie depuis sept ans. Ayinkè Moubachiratou s'approvisionne dans les marchés Béninois et extérieurs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire ses clients, Ayinkè Moubachiratou a sollicité et a obtenu, ensemble avec sa coéquipière, un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Ayinkè Moubachiratou se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This group is constituted of two persons. The group’s leader, named Ayinke Moubachiratou, is married and the mother of one child who attends school. She has a a primary school education level.
To provide for daily expenses, Ayinkè Moubachiratou has been active in hardware retail for seven years. Ayinkè Moubachiratou gets her supplies from markets in Benin or outside the country. In order to strengthen her business and satisfy her clientele, Ayinkè Moubachiratou solicited and obtained from Finadev a microloan shared with her copartner. Ayinkè Moubachiratou is placed on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase three lots packs of sheet metal, one box of locks, two rolls of wire and one box of super glue.

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr: Constance est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Le plus âgé a 28 ans et le moins âgé a 16 ans. Les quatre vont tous à l'école. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente des tomates en boîte, des savons, des macaronies et des bidons d'huile depuis treize ans. Constance s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Ses clients sont constitués des femmes et des hommes du quartier et de ses environs. Constance avec ses économies veut participer à la formation professionnelle de ses enfants et épargner. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en:
Constance is married and a mother of four. The oldest is twenty-eight and the youngest is sixteen. All four go to school.
She has been specialized in the retail of canned tomatoes, soap, macaroni pasta and jugs of oil for thirteen years. Constance gets her supplies from one of the local markets. Her clients are men and women from the district and nearby.
With her profit, Constance wants to participate to her children's professional education and to save more. Her ambition is to open a large store.

loans.use: to purchase two cartons of canned tomatoes, one carton of soap, one carton of macaroni and five jugs of oil.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: La Sra. Felicia tiene 46 años y es  madre soltera con 4 hijos que son de las edades de  22-19-17 y 12 años, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida, ella tiene su puesto de venta  que se encuentra en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Felicia utilizara este  préstamo para la compra  de material de construcción para la  remodelación  de su puesto de venta y tasi brindar una mayor comodidad a sus clientes, la Sra. Felicia tiene mucha clientela ya que trata a su clientes con mucha amabilidad y respeto y también por la buena elaboración de sus comidas la Sra. Felicia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia de otras personas que se dedican a la venta también de comida, va a utilizar los beneficios en brindar mayor comodidad a su familia comprando electrodomésticos para  su casa, se siente feliz ya gradecida con la institución ya que gracias a estas oportunidades que le  brindan mejoro de gran manera su calidad de vida. En la foto la Sra. Felicia se encuentra en compañía de su hija quien también le ayuda a vender.
texts.en:
Sra. Felicia is 46 years old and a single mother with four children (ages 22, 19, 17, and 12). She prepares and sells food from her vending stall, which is located at one of the busiest markets in the city of Cochabamba. This loan is her fourth cycle with Emprender. Sra. Felicia will use this loan to buy construction materials for remodeling her vending stall so that she can provide greater comfort for her customers. She has many customers and tries to treat them with great friendliness and respect. Her food is also well-prepared. Sra. Felicia faces challenges in her business, such as dealing with competition from other people who also sell food. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she will be able to provide greater comfort for her family through the purchase of appliances for her home.

Felicia is grateful to Emprender for giving her opportunities to improve her quality of life. In the photograph, Sra. Felicia is shown with her daughter who helps her with making sales.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for remodeling her vending stall.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy operates a grocery shop at Edukrom near Cape Coast. She has done this for two years. The items in her grocery shop include tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, drinks, biscuits, toffee, milk, and soap. She is married and has five children. Mercy uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Mercy plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Iglesia Evangelica De Cuyo Grande Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Iglesia Evangelica de Cuyo Grande” en la comunidad de Cuyo Grande del distrito Pisaq de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de artesanía, venta de verduras, engorde de ganado, venta de comestibles, crianza de animales menores y otros hacen servicio de hospedaje. 
 
(El señor Quintin está levantando la mano en la fotografía). El socio Quintin nació en la comunidad Cuyo Grande en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, él tiene 50 años y está casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. El socio Quintin se dedica a diferentes actividades como la artesanía, agricultura, transportes, construcción, servicio de turismo. Ya son varios años se dedica a estos trabajos y le va muy bien, él trabaja en diferentes horarios y por diferentes épocas durante todo el año. El socio Quintín nos cuenta que brinda servicio turístico vivencial con un grupo de vecinos y les va muy bien. Quintin en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar útiles de limpieza para el servicio turístico como por ejemplo jaboncillos, toallas y otras cosas mas.

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank "Iglesia Evangelica de Cuyo Grande” (Evangelical Church of Cuyo Grande) in the Cuyo Grande community of Pisaq District, Calca Province, Cusco Department.  This communal bank is made up of people who are always looking, each and every moment, for opportunities to get ahead and, through their efforts each day, to give their children a better future.  Examples of the members' businesses are selling handicrafts, vegetable sales, fattening of livestock, grocery sales, raising small animals and lodging services.
 
(Señor Quintin has his hand raised in the above photograph).  Member Quintin was born in the Cuyo Grande community, Pisaq  District, Calca Province.  He lives in the same community where he was born.  He is 50 years old and married.  Fruit of this beautiful relationship are four children.  Member Quintin makes his living from different businesses like handicrafts, agriculture, transportation, construction and tourist services.  He's made his living from these various jobs for many years and he is doing well.  He works different schedules in the different seasons all year long.  Member Quintín tells us that he offers a home-stay tourist service with a group of neighbors, and it's going very well for them.  At this time, Quintin needs the loan to purchase cleaning supplies for the tourist service, for example soaps, towels and other items.

The members are grateful for the opportunity that has been offered and promise to comply with each of their re-payments according to their different payment plans.

Cusco is located in the Cusco Distirct and Province, Cusco Department, right in the heart of the ancient Incan city.  It is known for being a tourist area and for its archeological and historical centers, its scenery, its history and for being an enchanting city in the Southern Region of the country.  Cusco is also known for being a highly tourist and commercial area, for its traditional celebration of "Inti Raymi" and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World is located there, “Machupicchu”.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning supplies for tourist services.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar is 36 years old. He lives in a small village with his parents. The family runs agricultural business. Emzar has milking cows; he produces dairy products and sells at the local open market. He also has pigs. Emzar takes good care of his livestock. He raises pigs and sells them after several months, with a price mark up. He also has a vineyard and sells the harvested grapes on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Lari.

Emzar has requested a loan for purchasing calves. He wants to raise and then sell them, after a few months. Grown calves will be sold with a price mark up. It will increase his agriculture business. With the increased amount of profit, he will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make the business more profitable. Taking into account the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Febronie

texts.en: Febronie is aged 42. She has four children, all going to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan for her business she will buy more beans, potatoes, yams and cassava to sell. She plans to use the profits to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more beans, potatoes, yams and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 40 years old. He is a father of one child, aged four. His wife works at the government institute. 

Jerome sells bed sheets and has spent twelve years in the business. With the loan, he wants to buy more bed sheets to sell. He plans to use the profits for savings.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 36 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her wholesale shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and improve more on her family's standards of living. Grace hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a big commercial house in town. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale.

loans.name: Nadia Rosario

texts.es:
Nadia es una joven de 22 años la cual es muy joven y entusiasta, su vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta pasear un poco y también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Arroz con pollo”. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo Nadia se encuentra estudiando la carrera de administración.

Con mucha dedicación Nadia trabaja como secretaria de atención a los clientes en una pequeña empresa de seguridad, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo trata bien a los clientes. 

Nadia está muy agradecida a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda Que le han brindado ella podrá pagar la universidad, de esta manera ella podrá seguir estudiando y realizando sus proyectos estudiantiles, así ella podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una profesional y tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Nadia is an enthusiastic young woman who is 22 years of age. Her home is located in the city of Ica, which is known for having warm weather throughout the entire year. In addition, Ica has developed in agriculture especially its crops of cotton, grapes, asparagus, peppers, and other products. When she has free time available, Nadia enjoys going out for short walks and eating one of her favorite dishes, the flavorful "arroz con pollo" (chicken with rice). With great effort in her work, Nadia is studying for a degree in Management.

Nadia works with great dedication as a secretary. She attends to the clients of a small security company. Nadia works approximately 10 hours a day. She believes she is doing well in her job because she is very responsible and, above all, treats the clients well.

Nadia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support that will be provided to her, she can pay for her university. As a result, she can continue studying and progressing with her student projects. She strives to fulfill her greatest dream of becoming a professional and having a house of her own.

loans.use: to pay for her university studies.

loans.name: Oliber

texts.es:
Oliber  es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Parcona, este distrito se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo los pobladores de la zona tiene un carisma especial y gran sentido de colaboración. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio y también en algunas oportunidades le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Con esfuerzo logro estudiar para ser técnico automotriz, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar en la universidad la carrera de ingeniería automotriz.

Con mucho entusiasmo Oliber trabaja día a día en su negocio como  chofer de taxi, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 45 clientes diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo muy respetuoso.

Oliber  está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar en mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo, de esta manera el podrá conducir de manera más segura tanto para él como para los clientes y mejorar sus ingresos; así el podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Formar una empresa de Taxis”.
texts.en:
Oliber is a very hardworking and enthusiastic man. He lives in the district of Parcona. This district is characterized by having a warm climate. Additionally, the citizens of the zone have a special charisma and great sense of collaboration. When he has free time he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends of the neighborhood and also on occasion he likes to eat one of his favorite dishes which is the delicious "Arroz con Pollo" (Rice with Chicken). With effort he was able to study to be an automotive technician, but he would have liked to study automotive engineering at university.

With much enthusiasm Oliber works about 10 hours daily in his business as a taxi driver and can attend to up to 45 clients daily. He believes that his work is going well because he is friendly with his clients and above all very respectful.

Oliber is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva and thanks to the support that they are providing him he will be able to conduct the maintenance and repair of his vehicle. In this way he will be able to drive more safely as much for himself as for his customers and improve his income; thus he will be able to continue fighting for the realization of his great dream: "To form a taxi company".

loans.use: for repairs and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Amparo Margarita

texts.es:
AMPARO MARGARITA tiene 40 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

AMPARO MARGARITA es auxiliar de enfermería en un centro médico. Solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, barillas, madera, bloque.
 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar los arreglos en la vivienda.

Los deafñiosa  alos que se enfrenta es el mal clima. Las compras lo hará en Ventanas.

El sueño es poder comprar una finca. En el tiempo libre le gusta arreglar la casa.
texts.en:
Amparo Margarita is 40 years old.  She is single and has two children.  She lives with her children in Chimbo, Bolívar Province.

Amparo Margarita is a nurses' aid in a medical center.  She is requesting the loan to purchase cement, rods, wood and blocks.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to make some improvements to her house.

The challenge that she faces is bad weather.  She will make her purchases in Ventanas.

Her dream is to be able to purchase a farm.  In her free time, Amparo Margarita likes to fix up her house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, wood and blocks.

loans.name: Laudelino

texts.es:
Don Laudelino, tiene 62 años de edad, casado, tiene 6 hijos, vive en una comunidad rural de Santa Bárbara.
el tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café, anteriormente cultivaba solo maíz y frijoles y también trabajaba de jornalero y poco a poco ha venido dándole mantenimiento a la tierra para sacar buenas cosechas de café. Las ventas de café en los últimos años han sido buenas, siempre hay variación de precios pero dice estar contento con la producción. Esta solicitando 13,000.00 Lempiras para comprar más insumos y fertilizantes para su cultivo y sacar mejores cosechas. Su sueño es seguir cuidando su finca motivado a que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Laudelino, age 62, is married and has six children.  He lives in a rural community in Santa Bárbara.

He has been growing coffee for over 20 years.  Before that he only grew corn and beans.  He also worked as a day worker.  Little by little he has been providing maintenance to the land in order to get good coffee harvests.

Coffee sales in the last few years have been good.  There is always a variation in prices, but he says that he is happy with the production.

He is requesting a loan for 13,000 lempiras to buy more supplies and fertilizers for his crops and to get better harvests.  His dream is to keep taking care of his farm as his motivation is for his children to get an education and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for maintenance of his coffee farm.

loans.name: Dinny Antonio

texts.es:
DINNY ANTONIO tiene 47 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos de 25 y 6 años de edad vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventans provincia de los ríos.

DINNY ANTONIO trabaja en una distribuidora de babano. Solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, barilla, bloque, madera. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los materiales para poder hacer los arreglos en la vivienda.

Los deafíos a los que se enfrenta en el trabajo son las lluvias que afectan el banano.
 El sueño e spoder comprarse una camioneta.

En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar en la finca.
texts.en:
Dinny Antonio is 47 years old.  He is married and has two children who are 25 and 6 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas, De Los Ríos Province.

Dinny Antonio works in a banana distribution center.  He is requesting the loan to purchase cement, rods, blocks and wood.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to purchase the materials needed to fix up his house.

His challenges at work are the rains, which effect the banana crop.

His dream is to be able to buy himself a pick-up truck.

In his free time, Dinny Antonio likes to work on the farm.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, blocks and wood.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es: La Sra. Ignacia tiene 60 años y es viuda con 4 hijos que son mayores de edad.  Ella se dedica a la venta de material de construcción como ripio, arena y ladrillos que se encuentran en la zona de Esquilan Chico, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ignacia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ladrillos por mayor,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, ya que ella quiere comprar por mayor ya que esta época el precio de ladrillo incrementa, la Sra.  Ignacia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia por la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios y reinvertirlos en el negocio su deseo  para su negocio es tener más clientela y así genera mayores ingresos para el bienestar de ella y de sus hijos ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 60 years old, and is a widow with four grown children. She makes a living selling construction materials, such as gravel, sand and bricks. She sells her products in the Esquilan Chico zone, and is requesting her first loan in order to purchase bricks in bulk for resale to customers before an expected price increase in the upcoming season. Her lack of capital to make the purchase on her own has led her to request this loan. 

Ignacia faces challenges in running her business, including lots of competition, and she plans to use the support from this loan to invest in her business. Her goal for her business is to increase her customer base and generate more income so that she can provide for her children, since this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy bricks in bulk.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Conchacalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE CONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana ella es conviviente y tiene 52 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de crianza de animales, la socia cría cuyes y gallinas los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como cuyes y gallinas al por mayor.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo despues, porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de panadería, negocio de venta de cuyes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members pictured above belong to the community bank, “Santa Rosa de Lima de Conchacalla.” The bank is located in the Anta district, which is located in the province of Anta, in the department of Cusco.

Juana is a member of the group, is 52 years old, and has two children. She makes a living raising and selling animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She raises the animals and fattens them up for eventual resale in various markets and fairs in her area. She begins work at 8:00 AM and works until 6:00 PM. Through her work in this business, she has been able to help provide for her children. 

Her dream is to grow her operation and eventually own a fixed location for a store from which she can sell her animals. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase guinea pigs and chickens in bulk. Juana is grateful to those people who help fulfill her loan and take part in making her dreams a reality. She has promised to make all her scheduled payments on time.

The members who appear in the smaller photo at the bottom right were unable to be present when the main photo was taken, since they had to be at work. 

The other members in the group make a living in agriculture, bread making, guinea pig sales, and food sales.

loans.use: to purchase animals such as guinea pigs and chickens in bulk.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 22 years old. He is just married and lives in a small village with his 21-year-old wife and parents. The family earns money through agricultural business. His father is a joiner and helps his son to cover family expenses. Mikheil has a plot of land, and he grows many types of vegetables and fruits. He also has a vineyard and makes very good wine. He sells harvested product on the local open market. He takes good care of his land, and his products are always of high quality. This is very important for the local population; they know about it, and Mikheil always has a lot of customers.
Mikheil wants to improve sanitary conditions in his house. This is very important for the newly-married couple, as well as for the other family members. Due to this fact, he requested a loan to repair the bathroom and to fix the roof of the house. With this loan he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair a bathroom and fix the roof

loans.name: Allan

texts.es: Allan, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está soltero, vive con su abuela por motivos de trabajo. El con el crédito va comprar unos utensilios de cocina como olla arrocera, sartén y otras cosa que se necesitan en el hogar. El tiene como meta ayudarle a su abuela con la compra de estas cosas para mejorar su bienestar familiar y facilitar las acciones domesticas de su abuela. El también piensa en su bienestar pues vive actualmente con ella y ella le realiza todo para que el trabaje con mayor facilidad pues con el horario de trabajo no le da tiempo de cocinar nada para él o realizar sus quehaceres. El con él trabaja piensa pagar el crédito rápido para salir con los pagos al día y tener cada día un mejor bienestar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Allan is 24 years old and single, and lives with his grandmother for work-related reasons. With the support from this loan, he plans to purchase kitchen utensils, such as a rice cooker, saucepan, and other items that they need in their home. His goal is to help his grandmother acquire these items to improve their wellbeing and to make her efforts in the kitchen much easier. He is also considering his own wellbeing in this situation, since he lives with his grandmother and helps her out around the house as he is able. His work schedule is very demanding, however, leaving him very little time to cook for them and help with household chores. 

He hopes to pay back the loan very quickly and, with each payment, improve their quality of lie. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he has not had loans before with state-run banks either. He decided on FUDECOSUR for this loan because of their lower interest rates and better client support.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen and domestic utensils.

loans.name: Rosa América

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer divorciada de 63 años que vive sola en "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del país, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del Ecuador. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Esta mujer trabajadora únicamente ha cursado la educación primaria, pero a pesar de ello ha sabido subsistir. Desde hace treinta años se dedica a vender ropa y artículos para el hogar como sábanas y edredones. Con esto ella lleva una vida modesta y a pesar de que el trabajar seis días a la semana y muchas veces cargar grandes fundas de ropa ella es optimista. Su capital de trabajo lo ha logrado mediante créditos, y esta vez requiere uno para invertir en mercadería ya que la temporada escolar es muy buena para las ventas y la cual va a aprovechar.

La competencia se ha incrementado, ahora hay más comerciantes en la calle pero Gloria cree que con esta inversión ella podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y mantener su clientela y quizás incrementarla.
texts.en:
Rosa is 63 years old.  She is divorced and lives alone in Santo Domingo. It is one of the country’s youngest cities and has now become the connection point between Sierra and Costa de Ecuador.  It is a special place, known not only for its rich ethnicity but also for the unusual landscapes found at the entrance to this beautiful city.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados now belongs to the recently formed province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas.  Santo Domingo’s main festival is celebrated with an influx of visitors that engage in commercial and cultural exchange.  A big fair takes place on the premises of the Asociación de Ganaderos where the best examples of breeds and crossbreeds raised on the region’s farms are shown in competitions.  

Despite having only completed a primary school education, this hard-working woman has managed to survive. For the past thirty years, she has been selling clothing and household items such as sheets and quilts.  With this income, she lives a modest life and despite the fact that she works six days a week and often carries large bags of clothing, she is optimistic.  She has raised working capital through credit, and this time she requires a loan to invest in merchandise because the school season is very good for sales and she plans to take advantage of it.  

Competition has increased as now there are more merchants on the street. However, Gloria believes that by making this investment, she will have a wider variety of products to offer and in this way, she will maintain and perhaps even increase her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for street vending.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Rosa es una señora de 41 años de edad, es soltera, pero tiene 2 hijos: Jesús de 18 años y estudiante de 3° de preparatoria y una niña llamada Brisa de 14 años, estudiante de 2° de secundaria. 
Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa (en ocasiones también vende flanes y gelatinas), negocio con el cual tiene 9 años. Desde que quedo soltera empezó a ver por su familia. Quiere un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y hacerlo más grande que tiene ahí en su casa para poder pasar más tiempo con su familia.
Rosa es una de las integrantes del Grupo las Margaritas, tal grupo está integrado por 11 mujeres trabajadoras que a continuación serán mencionadas y a la actividad a la que se dedican: Vitorina vende tamales, Rosa vende ropa, Obdulia vende abarrotes, Alba vende Carnes, Silveria vende pan, Norberta vende abarrotes, Aurora vende abarrotes, Marcela también vende abarrotes, Alfreda vende Ropa, Adelfa vende abarrotes y Maria vende comida.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 41, is single, but she has two children.  Jesús, age 18, is in his third year of high school.  Brisa, age 14, is in her second year of middle school.

Rosa sells clothes (on occasion she also sells flan and gelatin).  She has had the business for nine years.  Even since she was left single, she started taking care of her family.

She wants a loan to be able to stock her business and make it bigger.  She has the business in her house so that she is able to spend time with her family.

Rosa is one of the members of “Las Margaritas” (The Daisies) communal bank.  The communal bank is comprised of 11 hard-working women.  

The members and their business activities are:

Vitorina:  Sells tamales
Rosa:  Sells clothes
Obdulia:  Sells groceries
Alba:  Sells meat
Silveria:  Sells bread
Norberta:  Sells groceries
Aurora:  Sells groceries
Marcela:  Sells groceries
Alfreda:  Sells clothes
Adelfa:  Sells groceries
Maria:  Sells food

loans.use: to buy different types of clothing for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is 37 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Specioza has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Specioza has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy more essential commodities to resell, and it will help Specioza to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. Specioza hopes that in the future she will be able to have a successful business. 

Specioza is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Specioza who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more essential commodities to resell

loans.name: Katuku

texts.en: Katuku is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 18 years. She describes herself as honest and resilient. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate income for improving the business. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more crates of tomatoes for selling. Her business goal is to be a supplier of tomatoes within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes.

loans.name: Hilda Angelica

texts.es: La señora Hilda tiene 43 años es casada con dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 5 años, ella tiene un puesto  donde vende desayunos por las mañanas muy tempranos tiene para la venta de té y café, cerca un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad de La Paz, la Sra. Hilda es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que la Sra. Hilda les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara una cocina y también insumos como azúcar por mayor para la elaboración de sus desayunos, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo piensa que se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal.
texts.en:
Hilda, 43, is married with two children, ages 4 and 5.  She has a stand where she sells breakfast very early in the morning.  She sells tea and coffee near a very busy market in the city of La Paz.  Hilda is a very hardworking person who, little by little and with dedication, is acquiring stability and solvency as well as popularity.  She is well known by her customers because Hilda serves them in a very friendly way.

With the money from the loan she will buy a stove and also supplies to make her breakfasts, such as sugar wholesale.

She says she thinks that, with a lot of effort, she can grow more and so continue making a heritage for herself for her own and her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a stove and wholesale sugar.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela es una señora trabajadora, amable y un poco tímida; es originaria de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. Una de las playas mas turísticas de la población es la Playa de Corralero donde se puede disfrutar el sol y los ricos pescados a la talla.
Doña Gabriela tiene cincuenta y cuatro años de edad, se dedica a la venta de aceites para motores, moto bombas, moto cierras y automotriz. Lleva con su negocio veinte años y lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es atender con amabilidad a las personas. Dice que su hermana Julia también vende en el mismo local pero sus productos son accesorios para bombas. Gabriela está muy contenta de trabajar con su hermana ya que se apoyan una a la otra y que las dos tienen el mismo sueño de engrandecer su negocio.
Una de las cosas que no le gustan de su negocio es cuando tardan sus pedidos ya que pierde clientes.
Pidió el crédito para la compra de más aceites para bombas, moto cierras y automotriz para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a las personas trabajadoras y con deseos de mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a hardworking, kind, somewhat shy woman.  She’s from Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.  One of the most attractive beaches for tourists there is Playa de Corralero where one can enjoy the sun and delicious grilled fish.

Gabriela is 54 years old and sells lubricants for engines, pumps, chainsaws and motor vehicles.  She’s been in business 20 years and what she enjoys most about it is taking care of customers with kindness.  She says that her sister, Julia, also sells in the same place but she sells accessories for pumps.  Gabriela is very happy to work with her sister because they support one another and they both share the dream of enlarging their business.  
One of the things she doesn’t like about her business is when her deliveries are delayed because she loses customers.

She asked for the loan to buy more oil for pumps, chainsaws and motor vehicles to sell at retail and at wholesale.

She thanks the Fundación for helping working people who want to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy oil.

loans.name: Lado

texts.en:
Lado is 47 years old. He is married and lives with his family: his wife, Olja, two daughters (19 and 17 years old), and an 8-year-old son. His eldest daughter is a student, and their son goes to school. The family has one hectare of land. Lado and Olja grow potatoes on their land and sell the harvest locally to retailers. The main source of the income for the family used to be a truck owned by Lado. He was busy with the transportation of various goods and worked when he had orders. Recently, the truck got out of order, and Lado had to stop his operations. Right now, the total average monthly income for the family is 300 Laris. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the substantially poor category. 

At the moment, Lado’s truck is out of order and needs a serious renovation. He has requested a credit for purchasing spare parts for his truck. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” due to their low income. With the received credit, Lado will purchase spare parts for his truck and change the damaged ones. Afterwards, Lado will be able to re-start his transportation service and receive income, which will then be used for financing the education of his children as well as improving the living conditions for his family. The income of the family will increase by 300 – 400 Laris, which will mean a 100% – 125% increase. In addition to the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products that are available on the country’s capital market in case they need them.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is a 49-year-old farmer from a small village of Telavi District, East Georgia. He isn’t married and lives alone in his village house. He earns a living through agriculture. In particular, he is busy with bee-keeping. Gia has 8 bee hives with bee colonies. He harvests honey twice a year and sells it in the village. His total average monthly income is 150 Laris. According to Credo estimations, Gia belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Gia requested credit for financing his agricultural business start-up. He wants to sow maize on his own 0.8 hectare plot of land. His loan request was approved in the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. With the credit he receives, Gia will rent a tractor for tilling the land and purchase fertilizers and maize for sowing. He will work hard on the plot during spring and summer to get a good harvest. He will sell harvested maize on the Telavi market. Gia will earn additional income and will be able to purchase needed household goods to improve his living conditions. In addition, in the future Gia will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase maize and fertilizers.

loans.name: Red Rose Group

texts.en:
Maria, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children. One of them goes to school. She has been a tailor for five years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be her 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to repair her workplace by repairing the floor, installing mirrors and a place for fittings, buying materials for making dresses, and paying school fees. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more materials for her tailoring business. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Red Rose" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Eligy

texts.en: Eligy is a 32-year-old married man. He describes himself as diligent. He operates a pharmacy where he sells medicine. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located within a residential area and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more medicine. He had taken an earlier loan of KES 20,000 which he managed to repay successfully. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is 31 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Dorah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Dorah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale, and it will help Dorah to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Dorah hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a house. 

Dorah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dorah, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells charcoal at Edukrom near Cape Coast, which she has been doing for 13 years now. Mary is married and has six children. She uses her income  to support her husband, feed her family, and pay for her children’s school fees. Mary will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the profit from her expanded business, Mary will produce the charcoal she sells by herself.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is 54 years old. He lives in Telavi District with his family: wife Tamara and three daughters (9, 18 and 20 years old). His younger daughters go to a local school and the elder one is unemployed. Tamara is a housewife. Zaur works as an agricultural worker in the village. He mainly works in vineyards and is paid for this. The total average monthly income for the family is 100 Laris. According the Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "vulnerable poor" category. 

Zaur requested credit to start a small scale agricultural business. His loan request was approved in the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. With the credit he receives, Zaur will sow maize on a family-owned 0.5 hectare plot of land. He will work hard on the plot during spring and summer to get a good harvest. He will sell harvested maize on the, Telavi market. The family will get additional income and will be able to purchase needed household goods to improve family members’ living conditions. In addition to the above mentioned, in the future Zaur’s family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase maize for sowing.

loans.name: Kalume

texts.en: Kalume is a 28-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is 2 years old. He describes himself to be a go-getter and honest man. He operates a garage where he provides motor vehicle repair. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a residential area and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy spare parts. Kalume had previously taken four loans which he managed to repay successfully. He aspires to run a bigger garage within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Henry Lingie

texts.en: Henry is a 57-year-old married man. He has 4 children ranging from 24 years to 41 years old. He describes himself as active. He operates a retail store and pig farming business where he sells household items and pigs. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. He describes his biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy household items. Henry managed to repay his previous loan of KES 20,000. His business goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy household items for his retail shop.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: Shirley, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está soltera, vive con sus tres hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar maquinas de cocer para la confección de ropa. Ella tiene varios años de conocer y laborar en esta área por lo cual maneja mucho conocimiento en costura. Ella con esta compra tratara de montar un pequeño taller de costura para elaborar ropa para su posterior venta. Ella piensa en el futuro de sus hijos por lo cual quiere generar el máximo de ganancias y salir adelante con los pagos del crédito rápido y así tener más ingresos económicos para estabilizar la economía.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Shirley, 30, is single and lives with her three children, who are her biggest priority.  With the loan she is going to buy sewing machines to make clothing.  She has been familiar with and worked in this area for several years, so she has a lot of knowledge of sewing.

With this purchase she will try to set up a small tailor shop to make clothing to sell.  She thinks about her children's future, for which she wants to generate the maximum profits and get ahead quickly on her loan payments and so have more income to stabilize her finances. 

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously she had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a 33-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as a strong man. He operates a motorcycle business where he provides motorcycle transportation. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the increasing prices of petrol. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy his own taxi within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 16 years to 28 years old. He describes himself as diligent and outgoing. He operates a greenhouse where he sells tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is that the daily turnout of casual laborers seems to be diminishing and unpredictable. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase herbicides. This is his first loan. His business goal is to be a distributor of tomatoes within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier of horticultural crops in his hometown.

loans.use: to buy herbicides.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 14 years. She describes herself as outgoing and honest. She operates a restaurant where she sells tea, food, and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell. Her business goal is to run the restaurant in a permanent business premise within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a big well-equipped hotel.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing meals for sale.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a 34-year-old married woman. She has a son who is 3 years old. She describes herself as an innovative woman. She operates a recycling retail business where she sells recycled papers. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a market and her primary customers are the general public who visit the market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of maintenance. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a recycling waste paper machine. Her business goal is to run a wholesale company and create job opportunities for people within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable so she can support her family's financial needs.

loans.use: to buy a waste paper recycling machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase windows and desk for her students.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 53 años, es una mujer emprendedora, alegre y muy amble, le gustan los retos. Junto a su pareja, Manuel, tuvieron dos hijos. Su casa es propia, allí viven con su hija Farol, de 21 años, su nuera y un nieto.

Su negocio es la venta de comida los fines de semana. Prepara “juanes” (plato regional), pollo frito, asados y otros. Para ello, tiene una pequeña mesa que instala en el frontis de su casa donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a su clientela. Su actividad empieza levantándose muy temprano para realizar las compras de los ingredientes para la preparación del día. Lleva más de 15  años en éste negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y nuera para atender al público. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable, porque la clientela es constante y ha sabido ganarla por la buena sazón de sus comidas. Le gusta su actividad, pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas, ya que se ha visto crecer poco a poco.

Éste es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP. Comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues cuenta con su apoyo permanente.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de una mayor variedad de sus platillos. Así como también en bebidas gasificadas, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Irma is 53 years old. She is an enterprising, cheerful and very likable woman. She enjoys challenges. Together with her partner, Manuel, she has had two children. Her house is her own, and she lives there with her daughter Farol, age 21, her daughter-in-law and one grandchild.

Her business is selling food on weekends. She prepares “juanes” (a regional dish), fried chicken, barbecued meat and other foods. For this purpose, she has a small table installed at the front of her house where she serves her customers in a friendly and cordial manner. She begins her work by getting up very early to buy the ingredients for the day's food preparation. She has more than 15 years with this business, and she has the support of her daughter and her daughter-in-law in serving the customers. She considers her business quite profitable, because she has steady customers and she has been able to win them over with the delicious seasoning of her food. She likes her work, since it has brought her much personal and economic satisfaction, and she has seen it grow little by little. 

This is her third loan with the MFP institution. She comments that she feels good about her communal bank, since she can count on their ongoing support. 

With the amount she is requesting, 1500 Peruvian new soles, she will invest in buying groceries and ingredients to prepare a greater variety of her dishes, and she will also buy soft drinks, seeking more convenient prices by purchasing in volume.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for the food she prepares.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is a mother of four school-age children between four and fourteen years old. Jumwa runs a green grocery stall which has been running for the last two years. In this business, Jumwa sells tomatoes, vegetables, and fish.
She is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase fish for sale. Besides this business, Jumwa sells kerosene. She believes this venture will help her pay for her children’s school fees.
The only challenge has been drought, which destroys the vegetable crops. Her ambition is to own a large grocery stall in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is a married father of two children, one of whom is in school. He sells petrol in the region. This has proved a viable business due to the rise in the number of people who run the motorcycle business. Motorcycles are preferred by many people since they can get through to every interior area. This has necessitated the rise of small traders who sell the commodity (petrol) to most of the drivers who cannot purchase in bulk. Nathaniel has been doing this business for four years. Besides this, Nathaniel runs a charcoal business.
Nathaniel is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase petrol for sale. The challenge in his business has been during the rainy times when the riders decrease and the supply of charcoal decreases too.
Nathaniel believes the additional income will help in meeting his family's needs and hopes to open a larger petrol supply business.

loans.use: to purchase petrol for sale.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is a married father of four school-age children. He owns an electrical and bicycle spare parts shop. In this shop, he sells aerials, bulbs, extensions, belts, gears, etc. He has been running the business for the last four years.
Besides this, Anderson also runs a mobile phone charging business. He is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase soldering rods, gears, capacitors, belts, etc.
Anderson’s dream is to own a larger electrical/electronic shop in the near future as this he believes will help him educate his children who are already in primary and secondary school. The only challenge is the low business season at certain times of the year.

loans.use: to purchase soldering rods, gears, capacitors, belts, etc.

loans.name: Phoeby

texts.en:
Phoeby is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. The region boasts of a large open air market. She sells fish at the market. Fish forms a large part of a meal and is greatly loved by the coastal people. Phoeby has been running the business for the last ten years. She is a married mother of five school-age children. 

Phoeby was introduced to Milango almost one year ago and is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase additional stock of fish. The only challenge in the business is that she sells dry fish, which requires enough sunlight to dry. During rainy seasons, it takes longer to dry.

Phoeby believes this loan will help her educate her children and has the ambition of selling the fish in large scale instead of the current retail business. She also asserts that this will in turn improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish.

loans.name: Onyango

texts.en: Onyango is a 47-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 16 years. He describes himself to be humble and diligent. He operates a tailoring shop where he sells the clothes that he makes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located within a busy estate, and his primary customers are business people. He also works at one of the manufacturing companies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy clothing materials. Onyango has taken out a previous loan of KES 15,000 which he managed to repay in full. His business goal is to venture into running a shopping mall within five years.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She has a farming business which she has run for ten years. Chizi began the trade by keeping goats and then purchased a piece of land on which she plants trees. She has two school-age children.

She is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings (KES) to cultivate the farm. Her ambition is to purchase dairy cows and start selling milk. This, Chizi believes, will help her widen her income stream and also pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to hire labor for the cultivation of the farm.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 1 year to 10 years. She describes herself to be a determined and goal-oriented businesswoman. She operates a food stall where she sells snacks and cakes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located within a busy estate, and her primary customers are residents within the estate. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of ingredients. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy her own oven. She managed to repay well the outstanding loan amount. Her business goal is to be a supplier of cakes and snacks within five years.

loans.use: To buy an oven

loans.name: Lucila Quintileana

texts.es:
Lucila es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo entusiasta a pesar de haber tenido la pérdida de su esposo hace ya algunos años, supo reponerse y seguir adelante a pesar de la tristeza que sentía por su esposo ya que siempre la apoyaba y siempre le demostraba su afecto,  tiene 3 hijos los cuales son mayores y a quienes ama mucho ha pesar de que ya son mayores de edad. Su vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica; ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso en cualquier época del año, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika entre otros. Cuando Lucila tiene un tiempito libre le gusta cocinar, sobre todo preparara su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”.

Con mucho esfuerzo Lucila trabaja en su negocio de venta de gaseosas, refrescos y cerveza; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque siempre se da a respetar.

Lucila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora para poder conservar en buen estado sus productos, de esta manera podrá dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una tienda mas grande”.
texts.en:
Lucila is a hardworking woman and above all enthusiastic despite having lost her husband some years ago. She knew how to recover and move forward despite the sadness she felt for her husband who always supported her and always demonstrated his affection. She has three children who are adults and who she loves very much although they are already adults. Her home is in the city of Ica, a city that is characterized by hot weather whatever the time of the year. They work in agriculture especially cotton, grapes, asparagus, paprika and others. When Lucila has a little free time she likes to cook, especially her favorite dish which is the tasty Arroz con Pollo.

Lucila puts a lot of effort into her business selling sodas, soft drinks, and beer. She works around ten hours a day and can assist up to twenty customers daily. She believes that it is going well because she is very friendly with the customers and because she always shows them respect.

Lucila is very grateful for the Kiva loans and is grateful for the help that has been given her so she will be able to buy a freezer in order to keep her products in good shape because in this way she will be able to give better service to her clients and increase her earnings, and so she can continue fighting each day in order to reach her biggest dream of “having a much bigger store”.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa lives with her husband and four children. Adwowa produces charcoal to sell at Edukrom near Cape Coast, which she has been doing for 20 years now.  She uses her income to support her husband, feed her family, and pay for her children’s school fees. Adwowa will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce the charcoal she sells. With the profit from her expanded business, Adwowa will produce her charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to produce the charcoal she sells

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a 35-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from two years to six years. He describes himself to be a visionary man. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, maize, rice, cooking fat, baking flour, etc. His business is located within a busy estate, and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the impassible road network, especially during the rainy season. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy rice and sugar. He managed to repay his previous loan of KES 80,000 from SMEP DTM. His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Malula

texts.en:
Malula is 37 years old. She lives in a small village of Akhaltsikhe District, South Georgia. Malula lives with her family: her husband, Tariel, two adult daughters (who are 20 and 17 years old), and a 2-year-old son. Malula’s eldest daughter is a student, and the younger daughter goes to school. Malula is busy with her trade business. She purchases dairy products, haricots, as well as other vegetables from local farmers and sells them in Tbilisi (the capital city of Georgia). She goes to Tbilisi every weekend. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the substantially poor category.

Malula has requested a credit for starting up a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” due to their low-income status. With the received credit Malula will start up a dairy farm. She will purchase two cows. The cows will be placed in an old cattle shed located in Malula’s yard. She will produce, on average, 40 kg of cheese each month and sell the produced cheese in Tbilisi together with other products that she sells. The income of the family will increase by 300 - 400 Laris, which will mean a 50% – 60% increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve. Malula will be able to finance the education of her younger daughter and provide better care for her little son. In addition to the above mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is a 42-year-old married woman. She has two children with the ages of 15 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be a visionary woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells items such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a market, and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of vegetables and cereals sometimes. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy maize and beans. She has previously taken out a loan of KES 20,000, which she successfully repaid. Her business goal is to run a wholesale grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 42 años, es un hombre trabajador y decidido, además de alegre y muy atento. Su pareja, Carla, se dedica al comercio y es la madre de sus dos hijos: Leonardo de 6 años y Savier de 8 meses. Juntos están habitando cómodamente su casa propia.

La actividad que él realiza es la crianza, compra y venta de pollos. Cuenta con dos galpones con capacidad para 1000 pollos cada uno. Su actividad empieza de madrugada, comprando los pollos vivos en las avícolas y granjas, luego los lleva a vender a sus clientes en las embarcaciones fluviales, quienes le compran para la alimentación de sus pasajeros, retorna a su casa  por la tarde. Javier ha sabido ganarse sus clientes por ser conocido, ya que fue oficial de marina anteriormente. 
Se inició hace más de 4 años en este negocio y hasta el momento le ayuda su pareja, quien vende desde su casa. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, pues logra vender todo los pollos de compra. Decidió empezar con esta actividad por la necesidad de contar con un oficio, ya que perdió su trabajo por un accidente que le hizo perder una pierna, desplazándose con una pierna ortopédica.
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar su capacidad de compra y venta. Además para el futuro quiere abrir una bodega en su casa.

Éste es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP. Por se compromete a ser responsable con el  pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen récord crediticio.
Con el monto solicitado, de 4000 nuevos soles, invertirá en aumentar sus pollos, buscando precios más bajos por el volumen de compra. También adquirirá 1000 pollos bebé para crianza, valorizados en 1900 nuevos soles, más alimentos balanceados.
texts.en:
Javier is 42 years old and a hard working and determined man, and also happy and attentive. His partner, Carla, works in commerce and is the mother of his two sons: Leonardo who is 6 years old and Savier who is 8 months old. They are living comfortably in their own home.

Javier works breeding, buying and selling chickens. He has two barns with a capacity of 1000 chickens each. His work begins early in the morning, buying the live chickens from poultry farms and later takes them to sell to his customers on the riverboats, who buy them as food for their passengers. He returns to his home in the afternoon. Javier has procured his clients through his contacts, as he was formerly a naval officer. He began his business more than 4 years ago and so far has had the help of his partner who sells from home. He considers his business profitable enough for the earnings it gives him, as he is able to sell all the chickens he buys. He decided to begin this business through the necessity to have a job as he lost his work when he lost his leg due to an accident, and now uses a prosthetic leg.

Therefore, seeing the good results that he is having, he wants to enlarge his business and expand his capacity of buying and selling. Furthermore, in the future he wants to open a store in his house.

This is his first loan through the institution of MFP. He promises to be dependable making his payments in order to have a good credit record. With the proceeds of the loan, 4000 soles, he will invest in buying more chickens, looking for lower prices since he can buy in bulk. Also he will buy 1000 baby chickens, valued at 1900 soles, and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business. Sonia has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from rice retailing.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is 69 years old.  She is married and has 6 children. Warlita works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Warlita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent and other groceries.  In the future, Warlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 35 años, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de amable y cordial. Su pareja es Richard y padre de sus tres hijos: Hill de 16, Claus de 15 y Yadira de 13 años de edad. Juntos, viven en su casa propia.

La actividad que ella realiza es la venta de ropa y zapatos, para lo cual realiza viajes mensuales a la capital, donde compra buscando los mejores precios y modelos. Empezó con este negocio hace más de 6 años y lo considera rentable por las ganancias que le deja, con las que puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hija, así apoya a su pareja y sacar adelante, juntos, a su familia. Antes tenían problemas económicos, pues los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaba para cubrir todos sus gastos de alimentación, vestir y otros. Pero desde que empezó a trabajar ha logrado tener muchas satisfacciones con su negocio. Por ello tiene planes de hacerlo crecer y abrir una boutique en su casa.

Éste es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP. Comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más ropa y zapatos traídos desde la capital.
texts.en:
Isabel is a hard-working and industrious - as well as friendly and kind - 35-year-old woman. Her partner is Richard and he is the father of their three children: Hill, age 16, Claus, age 15, and Yadira, age 13. Together they live in their own home. 

Isabel works selling clothing and shoes, which she does by making monthly trips to the capital to look for and buy the best styles at the best prices. She started this business more than six years ago, and she considers it worthwhile due to the profit she makes - with which she can pay for household expenses and her daughter's education. This is her way of supporting her partner and getting ahead together as a family. Previously they had financial troubles, and her partner's income wasn't enough to cover all the expenses of groceries, clothing, and others. But since she's begun to work she's been very satisfied with her business. She has plans to grow the business and open a boutique in her home. 

This is Isabel's third loan with MFP. She says that she's very happy with her community bank, and considers it a united and supportive group. With the requested amount of 1200 PEN, she will purchase more clothing and shoes brought from the capital.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Javzandulam is 43 years old, married and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province. Her husband, Boldbaatar, is 45 years old and works as a guardsman in a vocational training school. The oldest daughter, Zayahuu, is 22 years old and she is a student in the university "Ih Zasag" in Ulaanbaatar. The second daughter, Zumbelmaa, is 20 years old and studies in a vocational training school. A son,  Zolbayar, is 17 years old and goes to secondary school. 

Javzandulam has been running a business trading milk products at the trading center for six years. First, she sold only milk and yogurt. Now she sells milk, yogurt, and also curd. She is willing to continue this business and to have her own dairy product store in future. 

Their standard of living is prosperous because her husband has a permanent job. Thus, they have a permanent family income. The borrower is courteous and talkative. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to produce and sell milk and dairy products .

loans.use: To produce and sell milk and dairy products.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
As a married mother of 8 children, Apoliaria works hard to support her family.  She has a peanut business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Apoliaria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more peanuts to sell to her customers.

Apoliaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 46 years old and widowed with one child.

Guillerma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Guillerma has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Guillerma aspires to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 29 years old, a married woman, living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has a life partner with her husband, who operates and manages a farming business along with her to ensure a good outcome. San has been engaged in this business for ages. Aside from crop husbandry, she raises some piglets at home for extra income. She has been blessed with two school-age children attending a local primary school.

Due to the lack of adequate capital, she is now looking for a loan through HKL to purchase a buffalo, seeds, and chemical fertilizers to use on her farmland. She hopes to obtain high production in the coming season through using this loan. She is thankful for the given funds to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo, seeds, and chemical fertilizers to use on her farmland.

loans.name: Jamellah

texts.en:
Jamellah is a 29-year-old married woman living in Lutao, Panaon. Her husband is a laborer. 

In order to add income in the family, she entered into a laundry business which started two years ago. She usually earns PHP 3,000 per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Jamellah will be able to buy more soaps and powders used in her business because of the PHP 5,000 rendered to her.
