Éste es su cuarto préstamo con MFP. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará más granos de maíz para seguir con su trabajo de procesamiento, también adquirirá granos de frijol para realizar la venta al por mayor.
texts.en:
Edinson, age 35, is a good man who is also hardworking and has business insight. He is single and has no children, so everything he earns is set aside for his parents. Edinson lives with them now, along with his sister. He has dedicated much of his life to providing the best for his family and improving their quality of life. His work consists of buying dry goods, such as corn and beans. The corn is processed so that it can be sold as chicken feed. He has a small grain mill that he shares with a friend and another member. They work and sell at the central market of the city and at various posts within the city. Edinson has been in this line of work for four years and it has allowed him to become independent and earn income. What he enjoys about his work is always having time available and taking pleasure in being able to walk around the entire city. He is doing well and earns an average return of 15% from his investment, which is then reinvested every three days. Like all young entrepreneurs, Edinson wants to have his own shop where he can process his goods himself and generate more income. For now, he is accumulating the capital he needs so that he can continue investing in what he has.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Once again, just as he did with his previous loans, he promises to complete his loan payments. Edinson is also grateful to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. The amount of 2,000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy more corn kernels so that he can continue his processing business. He will also acquire beans that he can sell in bulk.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to process and sell.

loans.name: Nagzigul

texts.ru: Нагзигул проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее дети и муж находятся в Российской Федерации. Она сама портниха по специальности. Сейчас Нагзигул предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Она берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки и необходимых материалов.
texts.en: Nagzigul lives in the Kumsangir district. She is 46 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband and children are living in Russia. Nagzigul is a dressmaker by trade, and she works out of her home. She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and other necessary materials.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other necessary materials

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
This is Emelita, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Luisito and they have four children. One of their children has a family, two are in high school, and one is working. Emelita works hard to provide for the expenses of their everyday lives. She operates a business renting apartments to people who need a place to stay. She also earns an income through a small fruit farm where she grows pineapples and mangoes and earns a minimum of 825 PHP daily.

Emelita is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to maintain her apartments and her farm. This loan will be a really big help for her family, and Emelita expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  She dreams of sending the rest of her children to school and of starting more businesses other than her apartment and farm businesses. Emelita faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and products needed in her businesses

loans.name: Badam

texts.en:
Badam is 52 years old and is widowed. He lives with his son in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic yurt. Badam runs a passenger minivan service between two outdoor bazaars in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been driving a car for many years. He used to work as a driver in a company but left that job due to a poor salary. Badam's vehicle has become badly damaged and he is unable to use it in his business.

Badam is requesting a loan to repair his vehicle and buy spare parts to repair his minivan. He believes his business will be easier and more profitable after his minivan is repaired.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his minivan

loans.name: Jerioth

texts.en:
Jerioth is married and has three children. For the past seven years, she has been running a grocery business to earn a living. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Jerioth has grown her business because she has learned business management skills.

Jerioth is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy cabbages, onions, and tomatoes. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and employ people.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions, and tomatoes

loans.name: Fernande Olanihou

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, Fernande Olanihou est mariée et mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commercialise des produits de la SOBEBRA depuis 19 ans. Fernande Olanihou s'approvisionne dans l'un des dépôts de Cotonou et les distribue dans les buvettes proches de sa résidence. Elle veut disposer des casiers de bière et de sucrerie afin de satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle, raison pour laquelle Fernande Olanihou a sollicité et a obtenu un concours auprès de Finadev.
texts.en: Fernande Olanihou is 46 years old, married and the mother of 5 children who all attend school. She has been selling SOBEBRA products for 19 years. Fernande Olanihou buys her inventory in Cotonou and sells them to small business near her home. She would like to have an inventory of beer and soft drinks to satisfy her clients' demands which is why she is working with Finadev to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase 10 cases of beer and 10 cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Hadjaratou

texts.fr: Mariée, âgée de 52 ans, Hadjaratou est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle  vend  des galettes, arachides et huiles d'arachide dans l'un des marchés de la place. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et ses clients sont souvent des revendeuses. Hadjaratou veut s'acheter des bidons d'huile, des paniers de galette et des mesures d'arachide. Afin de renforcer son commerce, Hadjaratou a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit  auprès de Finadev.
texts.en: Hadjaratou is 52 years old, married and the mother of four children who have all attended school. She sells biscuits, peanuts and peanut oil in the market place. She purchases her inventory at one of the markets in Benin and her clients are also often retailers. Hadjaratou would like to buy oil, biscuits and peanuts for resale. In an effort to strengthen her business, Hadjaratou has requested and received this loan from Finadev.

loans.use: 6 25 liter bottles of oil, 6 bundles of peanuts and 4 baskets of biscuits.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Justine est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont l'aîné a 15 ans et le benjamin 06 ans. Tous les trois vont à l'école. Elle vend les articles de quincaillerie qu'elle achète à l'extérieur du pays. Justine dispose déjà d'une clientèle potentielle à qui elle livre les articles aussitôt revenue du marché. Elle veut s'acheter des cartons de clé, tournevis, clous, rouleaux de grillage en plastique et métallique. Justine avec ses économies veut satisfaire ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Justine is married and the mother of three children; her oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 6.  All three attend school.

Justine sells hardware goods which she purchases abroad.  Justine already has a good group of regular customers, to whom she delivers her goods as soon as she is back from the market.  She wants to buy boxes of wrenches, screwdrivers, nails, and rolls of plastic and metal mesh.

With her savings, Justine intends to meet her personal needs as well as those of her children.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of wrenches, 1 box of screwdrivers, 1 box of nails, 2 rolls of plastic mesh and 2 rolls of metal mesh.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas tiene 24 años es soltero con una hija,  es de la ciudad de Paraguarí. Blas se dedica al macate (venta ambulante) hace aproximadamente un año, pero ya había empezado en esto hace  más de 3 años como cobrador ya que casi toda su familia trabaja en este mismo ramo y con el obtienen muy buen ingreso mensual aparte de que ya cuenta con una clientela formada y  zonas de trabajo.
El vende frazadas, sabanas, prendas, zapatos, jeans y todo tipo de artículos, con lo cual tiene los ingresos necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Blas solicita el crédito para la compra de jeans, calzados, camperas y demás artículos para la venta, con lo que podrá aumentar sus zonas de venta y tendrá un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Blas is 24 years old, single, and has a daughter. He is from the city of Paraguarí. Blas has been a "macate" (traveling merchant) for approximately one year. However, he began working as a collector and was in that line of work for three years because almost everyone in his family works in the same field. Blas earns a very good monthly income because he already has an established customer base and existing sales territories. He sells blankets, bed sheets, clothes, shoes, jeans, and all types of products. Selling this merchandise enables him to generate the necessary income to help his family.

Blas is requesting a loan to buy jeans, shoes, jackets, and other products to sell so that he can expand his sales territories and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shoes, jackets, and other products.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Asunta;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de picanteria ella vende diversos tipos de platos tipicos,la socia trabaja todos los dias en su negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia a la vez vende chicha y cerveza,la socia es una persona alegre y resposable con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicito el prestamo para la compra de insumos para elaborar chicha como maiz. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the Madres Trabajadoras [Working Mothers] community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the Cusco province and department. 

Asunta alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business where she sells various kinds of traditional meals. She works every day at her business, as this is her way of getting her family ahead. At the same time she sells chicha [a corn based drink] and beer. Asunta is a cheerful and responsible person with a strong desire to get ahead in life. 

She is requesting this loan to buy goods, such as corn, to make chicha. 

Asunta is happy to have the loan and promises to make her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy goods to make chicha [a corn based drink], such as corn.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.pt:
Casada mãe de 1 filho que ainda continua com os Estudos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
É comerciante e dona do seu próprio negocio há mais de 3 anos e vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Com presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, óleo, açúcar, amendoim, arroz e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

No futuro pretende continuar com os seus estudos e dedicar-se cada vez mais ao seu negócio para aumentar a sua renda. Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder solicitar mais. 
Tem como desafios, concluir a sua casa através da renda do seu negócio para melhor confortar a sua família.
texts.en:
Delfina is married and has one son who still goes to school. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has been a businesswoman and the owner of her own business for more than three years. Delfina sells staple goods. She intends to use this loan to buy products (flour, oil, sugar, peanuts, rice and other items) to increase the amount of merchandise she has in stock.

In the future, she intends to continue with her studies and devote herself even more to her business so she can increase her income. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can ask for another loan.

One of Delfina's challenges is using her income to finish her house so she can make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (flour, oil, sugar, peanuts, rice, etc.).

loans.name: Chie

texts.en:
Chie is 61 years old and a resident of the Prey Chor district. Her family's main business is rice farming and Chie can earn a suitable living to raise her family. She spends most of her time working in the fields to ensure a high crop production, especially in the rainy season. Being a responsible mother, Chie is determined to ensure a good future for her children. Four of her children are already married and the remaining one is still single.

Chie is requesting a loan from HKL, a long-standing Kiva partner, to purchase a motorcycle for home use. This will provide good transportation services for her family and allow them to go anywhere they wish to go. Chie's business goal is to expand the size of her land and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use

loans.name: Myagmardagva

texts.en:
Mr. Myagmardagva, 49 runs a freight transportation business around Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2004, he has been running his business, and he usually carries construction materials between two points. Currently, he lives with his wife on his plot of land.  All his children moved out of their parent’s house.

He wanted to renovate his old house to run a grocery store in the roof hollow space. He thinks that this business will increase the income of his family and improve their living conditions in the future. Now he needs a loan to buy the building materials to renovate his roof hollow for opening the grocery store.

loans.use: To buy the building materials to renovate his roof hollow for opening a grocery store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 48, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Florante who works in aircraft maintenance, and is the mother of three children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Rosalinda believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Rosalinda operates an internet café business. There is more need now for services like these as demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing a resume, or for any office documentation.  She has people who would just love to surf the net and any social network. She also operates a variety store and she has an apartment available for rentals. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2500 in profit every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy an additional computer, mouse, keyboard, mouse pad, and other supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Rosalinda dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ismail has been working hard to manage his big kraal, which sells cattle. 

To help expand his business, Ismail has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cattle for resale, and will help Ismail to generate greater profits and increase his income. Ismail hopes that, in the future, he will be able to own a hardware business and a bigger farm. 

Ismail is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ismail who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance, 27 years old, is married and has one child. She sells sweet potatoes and cassava. She would like to use this loan to get more sweet potatoes for the store because most of the customers like them very much. Esperance will use the profits from the business for savings in order to accumulate capital for the future.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Jadeo

texts.en:
Jadeo is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, both currently in school. For the past 8 years, Jadeo has been working hard to manage his big kraal, which sells cattle. 

To help expand his business, Jadeo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cattle for resale, and will help Jadeo to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Jadeo hopes that, in the future, he will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Jadeo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jadeo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale,

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine, 29 years old, has three children aged between 6 and 9, all attending school. She has been selling skirts for two years. Francine has realized that her business needs more capital, so she has requested a loan to increase the volume of her business. She will use the profits from the business to help upgrade it.

loans.use: To buy more shirts to sell.

loans.name: Sèmèton Germain

texts.fr: Germaine Sèmèton est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Le plus âgé a 14 ans et le plus jeune a 07 ans. Ils tous scolarisés et elle commercialise des articles de mercerie dans une baraque à domicile. Germaine Sèmèton s'approvisionne à Cotonou. Sa clientèle est constituée de couturiers et tailleurs.  Germaine Sèmèton veut s'acheter des cartons d'aiguille, des cartons de file et des rouleaux de fermeture. En vue d'achalander son étalage et d'avoir un grand nombre de profit, Germaine Sèmèton a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev.
texts.en: Germaine Sèmèton is married and the mother of three. Her eldest child is 14 years old, and the youngest is seven. They are all in school. She sells sewing supplies from a shed near her home. Germaine Sèmèton stocks up in Coutonou. Her customer base is composed of dressmakers and tailors. She would like to buy some boxes of needles and thread as well rolls of zippers. In order to expand her stock and increase her revenues, Germaine Sèmèton has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of thread, four rolls of zippers and four boxes of needles.

loans.name: Mahawa

texts.fr:
Jeune  femme très dynamique, elle s’active dans la transformation des produits locaux particulièrement dans la transformation des graines d’arachide. Âgée de 30 ans, cela fait plus de cinq ans qu’elle s’active dans ce domaine, elle  très engagée dans son banc villageois d’ailleurs elle fait parti du comité de gestion.

 Avec son crédit elle compte acheter plus de vingt sacs d’arachide pour la transformation et la revente dans d’autres régions du pays. 

Les bénéfices de  son activité lui permettront de se prendre en charge par rapport à ses besoins et ceux des parents.
texts.en:
This is a very dynamic young woman who is actively involved in the processing of local products, particularly in the processing of groundnut seeds.  She is 30 years old and has been involved in this field for more than five years.  She is also very involved within her Banc Villageois and belongs to its management committee.

With her loan, she is planning to buy more than twenty sacks of groundnut to be processed and resold in other regions of the country.

The profits from her business will allow her to provide for herself, to meet her own needs and to support her parents.

loans.use: to buy more than 20 sacks of groundnut, to be processed and resold in other regions of the country.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel used his previous loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy ingredients such as baking flour, cooking fat, and charcoal. He was able to use the ingredients to prepare doughnuts, which he sold and made good profits.  He used the additional income from his business to add more ingredients. 
He has requested another loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Sameea's Group

texts.en:
Sameea is a very talented lady who sews clothes for her community clients to financially support her family. She began her business three years ago. Sameea has given birth to five sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works as a laborer and the other three are studying and living at home. Sameea's husband runs a motorcycle rental business and charges hourly rental fees. Sameea learned her sewing skills from her mother before her marriage and now she earns a reasonably good income from her business. 

Sameea is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to buy a sewing machine that will allow her to finish her orders more quickly. She is confident that her business will be successful as the result of her loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, 36 years old, has six children, all attending primary schools. For the past 3 years, Alice has operated a business selling peas and beans. She wants this loan to buy more beans and peas to sell. Alice plans to use the profits from the business to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans and peas to sell.

loans.name: Fauste

texts.en: Fauste, 33 years old, has been selling mattresses for seven years. She is married to a carpenter and they have four children. Fauste wants to use this loan to buy more mattresses to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Berne

texts.en: Berne, aged 32, has two children, 6 and 10. She has been selling stoves for 12 years. Berne has requested this loan to buy more stoves because of customer demand. She plans to use the profits to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more stoves to sell.

loans.name: Dien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dien was born in 1962. She has 2 children; her son is married and her daughter is a laborer. Mrs. Dien's husband is a builder and a farmer. For the past 3 years, Mrs. Dien has made tofu, grown rice and raised pigs to earn a living. Her monthly income is about 3,000,000 VND and the family's total income is 7,000,000 VND. Mrs. Dien needs loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy small pigs and to buy beans to make tofu. She has been a member of SEDA since 2004 and is now the leader of a 3-member group.

Phong, 28 years old, has one child. He is a contractor. He wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND for breeding.

Lan, 49 years old, has one child. She sells noodles and Pho for a living. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND for breeding.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and to buy beans to make tofu

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat, 51 years old, is married and is responsible for two children. She lives in Prey Chor district. She is a local rice farmer who has been involved in this type of business for almost 32 years. During this period, she has managed her business well and earns a good income. 

Yat would like to ask for a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase an additional plot of farmland to expand her rice production. She hopes that someday she will become financially stable, in order to provide comfortable living conditions for her family. Yat plans to further educate her two children so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase an additional plot of farmland to expand her rice production.

loans.name: Elzabeth

texts.en: Elzabeth sells groundnut paste, which she has been doing for two years.  She is married to a farmer and has one child.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay for their children’s school fees. Elzabeth will use her loan to purchase bags of groundnuts to prepare for her groundnut paste to sell. With her profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To prepare her groundnut paste to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Rose has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells spare motor parts. 

To help expand her business, Rose is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more motor spare parts. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and pay some of her children's school fees. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more profits. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Fred has been working hard to manage his boutique where he sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Fred is requesting a 2000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes to sell. His loan will help him generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to have a successful business. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Seun is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. She lives with her family in the Kampong Chhnang province. Seun works as a rice farmer and uses her income to pay for daily food and allowances for her school-age children. Some of her children help her to manage her business every rainy season. 

Seun is requesting a 3,000,000 KHR loan to buy a rice-husking machine. This machine will really help her to more effectively run her business and she will be able to provide this service to local farmers to earn extra income. In the future, Seun wants to further develop her business to increase her family's standard of living and she would like to keep generating a good income.

loans.use: to buy a rice-husking machine

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy, 30, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Javier and has two children. Ivy works hard because she wants to educate her children all the way through college.

Ivy oversees operations of the family's tricycle transportation business. A Philippine tricycle is made by mounting a sidecar to a regular motorbike. They are used mainly to ferry passengers short distances along smaller, more residential streets, often too or from jeepneys or other public utility vehicles. They are also used for transporting cargo too heavy to carry by hand and over a distance too short or roads too congested for motor transport. During the rainy season, tricycles are useful as a way to avoid walking through floodwaters. Along with the jeepney, the motorized tricycle and the engine-powered kuliglig, the open-air pedicab provides shade when needed.

To help her continue operations of her business, Ivy is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan in order to buy new bikes to be attached to the pedicabs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Ivy dreams of being able to buy the bikes. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. Ivy faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Castigo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
É operário agrícola na área de estatística e com presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, chapas de Zinco, e outros) para melhorar a sua casa.

No futuro pretende desenvolver mais a nível profissional, e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família. Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder solicitar mais. 
Tem como desafios, concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a família e cuidar da sua saúde.
texts.en:
Castigo is the father of four children, all of whom go to school.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.  He is an agricultural worker in the area and with this current loan, he plans to buy construction materials (cement, beams, metal sheets, etc.) to improve his home.

In the future, he wants to progress more at the professional level to improve his family's living conditions.  He promises to make his payments on time so he will be able to request more loans.

His challenge is to complete his home to improve his family's comfort and to care for their health.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, beams, metal sheets, etc.).

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет двоих детей, старшему 29 лет, а младшему 10 лет. В районе  Шарофата очень развита торговля и она занимается купле- продажей женских тканей и одежды. Кроме этого она шьет и продает занавески. Шарофат хочет расширить свой бизнес чтобы получить хорошую прибыль и улучшить свои жилищные условия. Шарофат хотела бы получить займ для покупки женских тканей и одежды с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Sharofat is a hardworking and conscientious woman.  She is divorced and is raising two children, the older one is 29 years old and the younger one is 10.  In Sharofat's neighborhood trade is very developed and she purchases and sells women's fabrics and clothing.  In addition, she sews and sells curtains.  Sharofat would like to grow her business in order to earn a good income and improve her living conditions.  Sharofat would like to take out a loan to purchase women's fabrics and clothing in order to increase her working capital.  She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy clothing and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Denise

texts.en: Denise is 28 years old. She sells cassava and sweet potatoes. She has spent five years in the business of foodstuffs. The loan use will be for adding cassava and sweet potatoes to sell. The profits will be for savings.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Emerance

texts.en: Emerance is 33 years old. She owns a store where she sells general merchandise. She wants to use the loan to buy more basins, trousers and skirts to sell. The profits from the business will be saved in order to have enough capital in the future.

loans.use: To buy more basins, trousers and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Muniran's Group

texts.en:
Muniran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s construction supplies business. With the loan investment, he will buy cement, bricks, sand, etc. in larger quantities that will help him fulfill larger orders on time and increase his profits. He is a very professional businessman and his clients are very happy with his good quality products. 

Muniran is a housewife as well as a businesswoman. Her work is home-based. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and supplements the income of her family. Besides her work, she also spends the required time on her household work. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She is confident about her family’s better future as a result of the loan investment in her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Ma. Gracia

texts.en:
This is Ma. Gracia, 27, who is a resident of Bacoor Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marcelo, a driver, and she is a mother to their child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Gracia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Ma. Gracia earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 830 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
. 
Ma. Gracia dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products

loans.name: Alda

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filha que ainda continua com os Estudos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
É professora, com presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, areia, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.

No futuro pretende fazer o Ensino superior para melhorar o seu salário. Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder solicitar mais. 
Tem como desafios, apostar nos seus Estudos.
texts.en:
Alda is a single mother of one daughter and is still working on her education.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.  She is a teacher, and with this current loan, she will buy construction materials (stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to continue building her home.

In the future, she wants to go to college to improve her salary.  She promises to make all of her payments on time so she can request more loans.  Her challenge is investing in her education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Armindo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos que ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais um irmão e um sobrinho. 
É comerciante e dono do seu próprio negócio onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade, com presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, óleo, arroz, farinha, e outros) para aumentar quantidade do seu negocio.

No futuro pretende comprar um mini bus para transporte de passageiros e um tractor para lavrar os seus campos. Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder solicitar mais. 
Tem como desafios, comprar uma camioneta para transportar os produtos para o seu estabelecimento.
texts.en:
Armindo is married and is the father of five children who are all in school.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his brother and nephew.  He owns his own business where he sells basic goods.  With this current loan, he will buy products to increase his inventory (peanuts, butter, rice, flour, etc.).  

In the future, he hopes to buy a mini bus to transport passengers and a tractor to farm his land.  He promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans in the future.

His challenge is buying a truck to transport his products to his business.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (peanuts, butter, rice, flour, etc.).

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan is 38 years old and a mother of three children who are still dependent on her and still in school. She lives with her family in a village located in the Mongkol Borey district and earns a living through planting beans, cucumbers, and eggplant. She has been in this business for five years. 

Lan has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her improve her living standard. As a result, she currently can earn around 24,000 KHR per day to feed and support her family. With her good business, she is now leading another member who has been with VisionFund for one cycle. They are applying for loans of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She hopes to grow healthy crops,  sell them for a good price and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Ndune

texts.en:
Hilton is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She runs a retail shop that has been in operation for four years. Her business is located in the area normally visited by truck drivers linking the two Kenyan cities. She is married and has four children. She received the startup capital from friends and family members.

She joined Milango upon introduction by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to add retail stock for a new shop she intends to open. The only challenge in the business has been the high cost of retail stock and the price fluctuations. She believes the business will grow and she will soon have a chain of businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock for a new retail shop

loans.name: Kadenge

texts.en:
Kadenge lives in the coastal town of Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. Kadenge runs a bicycle repair stall that has been in operation for six years. In this business, he sells bicycle oil and spare parts and repairs bicycles.

He was introduced to Milango by an employee and he decided to join in order to access credit. Kadenge is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of bicycle oil and spare parts.

He says the business has high sales during the first and the last week of every month. Kadenge’s ambition is to own a larger shop where he can also sell new bicycles. He believes this will help provide for his family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle oil and spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de mates frescos y tambien hace refrescos,la socia en forma ambulatoria desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los refrescos y mates.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos como maiz y hierbas medicinales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower still has her business selling fresh infusions, and she also makes soft drinks. She has a travelling stall and sells her products from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm. Through her business, she is able to raise her children. Her dream is to have her own premises where she can sell soft drinks and infusions. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as corn and herbs.

She is grateful for the loan, and pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as corn and medicinal herbs.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa sells kenkey* at Abresiah near Elmina. She has been selling kenkey for 6 years. She is a single parent and has 4 children. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children and to pay their school fees. Theresa needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Theresa wishes to expand her business. 

*fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves, often accompanied by fried fish

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She operates a mobile money transfer shop, which she has been running for three years. Her business is located in the deeper parts of the coastal strip (called Bamba), which is normally not accessible through conventional means. This has made formal banking services unavailable to the residents of such areas. Regardless, they still need to communicate with relatives and business partners. This is the lifeline of Rachael’s business. In this business, she transfers money to customers who want to receive and/or send money and she sells credit/calling cards and cell phone communication lines.

After introduction to Milango by her friends, Rachael is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase more cell phone lines (Sim cards) and credit calling cards and to add to the till float in the mobile money transfer account.

The challenge has been the little transactional float/till money that she has and this Rachael believes will be sorted out upon receipt of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cell phone lines (Sim cards) and credit calling cards and to add to the till float.

loans.name: Yat Loek's Group

texts.en:
Yat Loek is 45 years old and married. She lives in a rural area located in the Mongkol Borey district, Cambodia. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are working in Thailand to help support the family. To make a living, she has been farming rice for several years in the village. With her current business, she can earn around 14,000 KHR per day to support her family.

Yat Loek's group consists of two female members who have been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. After successfully paying back the loan, she is leading her group to apply for another loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 800,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she wants to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice paddy. With this loan, she hopes to make more good quality rice and sell it for a good price to earn a larger income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice paddy

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence extracts palm oil and kennel oil for sale at Abreshia near Elmina. Florence is married to a framer and has 4 children.  She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children.  Florence will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and palm kennel to extract her oil for sale. With the new profit, she wishes to buy a machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and palm kennel to extract her oil for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a small-scale trader. She sells food items such as plantains, cassava, cocoyam (taro, a root crop), brooms and vegetables.  Mary has been in this business for 3 years now. She is divorced and has 3 children.  She uses her income for the general upkeep of her children. Mary will use her loan to purchase food items and vegetables to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Muchakata Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 31-year-old Lovemore from Masvingo. He is married with one child who attends school.  Lovemore runs a retail business selling sugar beans, dried fish and soya meat. The business has been in operation for 10 years. He says the main challenge he faces is high transport costs. Lovemore has requested a loan of $400 to buy sugar beans, dried fish and soya mincemeat. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to be able to take care of his family. In the future, Lovemore plans to own a shop in Masvingo Central Business District.

loans.use: To buy sugar beans and dried fish for resale

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is 34 years old. She sells trousers and shirts. She has been doing this business for the past five years. The loan will be used to buy more trousers and shirts for sale. With the profits from the business, she will build a house for her residence.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and shirts for sale

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 31 years old. She sells shoes for both ladies and gents. She has spent two years in the business. She wants the loan to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build savings.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 32 years old. She has been selling corn flour for the past six months. She has requested the loan to buy a half ton of corn flour for sale. With the profits, she plans to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy more corn flour for sale

loans.name: Juan Humberto

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso en cualquier época del año, también se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros; en todo el año recibe muchos turistas ya que en esta ciudad se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina la cual se encuentra en medio de dunas espectaculares. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta jugar futbol y también comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Escabeche de Pescado”. El logro estudiar la carrera técnica de electricidad, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar en la universidad para ser Ingeniero Técnico.

Con mucho entusiasmo Juan trabaja en su negocio de mantenimiento y reparación de computadoras  y sistemas eléctricos, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocida por los clientes y porque es muy amable en la atención.

Juan esta muy feliz y agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas y materiales para la reparación de los equipos de computo como tarjetas de memoria, alicates pequeños, flayers, entre otros; así de esta manera el podrá tener los materiales necesarios para la realización de su trabajo y también mejorara sus ingresos; lo que le permitirá seguir mejorando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de mantenimiento de computadoras”.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man, 28 years old, who lives in the city of Ica, a place known for a warm climate year round. It is also known for farming, especially cotton, grapes, asparagus, paprika, and other things. There are many tourists throughout the year because the Huacachina Lagoon is located here, in the middle of spectacular sand dunes. When he has free time, Juan likes to play soccer and eat his favorite food, "escabeche de pescado" [pickled fish]. He studied electronics at a technical school, but he would have liked to go to university to be a technical engineer. 

Juan works with enthusiasm at his business maintaining and repairing computers and electronic systems. He works around 8 hours a day and can tend to up to 15 clients in a day. He says he thinks that his business is going well because he's known by his customers and because he provides friendly service.

Juan is very happy and grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they've given him, he will be able to buy tools and materials for repairing computers, like memory cards, needle-nose pliers, , among other things. This way he will have the necessary materials to do his work and increase his income. This will allow him to continue making progress towards his greatest dream: "to have a computer maintenance business."

loans.use: to buy materials and tools (memory cards, needle-nose pliers, pliers, and other things)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi y servicio de turismo,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijo,el sueño del socio es mejorar el servicio de taxi.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The lending club member works in transportation. He has a car that service as a taxi and as tourist transportation. He works from 7am until 6pm. Through his work, he takes care of his son. His dream is to improve his taxi service. He is asking for a loan to buy tires for his car. 

He is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, aged 42, is married to a businessman and they have five children. She has been running a canteen for the past three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more bread, juices, and fresh dairy for sale in the canteen. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more breads, juices, and fresh dairy for sale

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 36 years old. She owns a retail shop where she sells different snacks and beverages. With the loan, she wants to add more snacks and beverages for sale. The profits from the business will be used for buying a motor bike which will generate another income.

loans.use: To buy more snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elsa; La socia continua trabajando en su negocio de venta de comida ,ella elabora diversos platos al dia como arroz con pollo,saltado entre otros , la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria por el centro de la ciudad,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa  siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz y aceite.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “Madres Trabajadoras” ["Working Mothers"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Santiago, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Her name is Elsa, and she is continuing to work in her business selling food. She prepares various dishes each day such as arroz con pollo [chicken and rice], and saltado [meat and potatoes], among others. The borrower works as a mobile vendor in the city center. She is a responsible and dedicated person, and in this way she is helping her family get ahead. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her business, such as rice and cooking oil.

The borrower is grateful to those who are contributing to fulfilling this dream, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business, such as rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Alix

texts.es: Alix  de 48 años de edad tiene dos negocios, por un lado se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artículos para bebes por encargos  y por otro lado a la venta de mercancía de calzado infantil, los que compra a pequeños negocios  de la ciudad y algunos  los mandan a fabricar con muestras tomadas delos catálogos y los distribuye en almacenes de toda la Costa Norte del País. Alix ha recibido 4 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos ha logrado su crecimiento  en el mercado y en su estructura organizacional, ella tenía inicialmente un mercado muy doméstico y  ha logrado ampliarlo a otras regiones del país. Su meta mas adelante es tener su código de barras y lograr vender a nivel internacional en países vecinos inicialmente hasta lograr mayor extensión. Su mayor desafío es la competencia y la permanecía en sus viajes, lo cual le permite asegurar el mercado de clientes y aumentar su volumen de ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a su quinto financiamiento, con el cual comprar telas, encajes, elásticos, calzado infantil y materiales en general, pues ella quiere ganar descuentos especiales, que tienen sus proveedores a propósitos de sus compras de contado y en mayor volumen. Esta es justamente la razón de éxito de esta inversión, con la cual fabricará artículos para bebé y comprará calzado, a los cuales agregará valor con su toque en el diseño técnico y acabado.
texts.en:
Alix, 48, has two businesses. One is making and selling baby clothing by order. The other is selling infant footwear that she buys in the city or orders from samples from the catalogs and distributes to stores throughout the north coast of the country. Alix has received 4 loans from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation which have helped her to increase her market and her organizational structure. She initially had a very local market and has been able to expand to other regions of the country. Her goal for the future is to have a bar code and sell internationally, initially in neighboring countries until she expands further. Her greatest challenge is competition and the duration of her travels, which allow her to shore up her customer base and increase her sales volume. 

Currently she is applying for her 5th loan which she will use to buy fabric, lace, elastic, infant footwear and general materials. She wants to get them at the special discounts that her suppliers give when she buys in bulk and in cash. This is exactly the reason that her investment will be successful. She will make baby clothing and buy footwear, which she will add value to with her design techniques and finishing touches.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace, elastic, baby shoes and other materials.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Nicasia;La socia continua con su negocio de venta de golosinas ,ella trabaja de forma ambulatoria en uno de los colegios del Cusco,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mas golosinas para su negocio como galletas y dulces.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member, Nicasia, belongs to the communal bank 'Madres Trabajadoras' (Working Mothers). The bank is located in the district of Santiago, belonging to the province of Cusco and the administrative division of Cusco.

Nicasia has continued her business selling sweets, working as a street vendor in one of the colleges in Cusco. She has been in this business for many years, which has meant that she has been able to help her family to succeed. 

Nicasia is requesting this loan to buy more supplies for her business, such as cookies and sweets. She is grateful to those who are a part of her dream, and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her business, such as cookies and sweets.

loans.name: Sr. De Huanca De Coya Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Sr. de Huanca de Coya” en el distrito de Coya de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Este banco comunal está organizado de la siguiente manera la socia Graciela es la presidenta, el socio Mario es el secretario, la socia Rosa es la tesorera y la socia Cristina es la fiscal. 

Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de artesanía, crianza de animales menores, compra y venta de ganado, engorde de ganado, venta de comestibles, otros hacen servicio de transporte y trabajan como albañil y empleado público.         
 
La socia Graciela tiene 46 años edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de Graciela es la venta de comida, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde prepara desayuno, almuerzo y diferentes platos tipos de la región. Ya son 15 años se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad Graciela requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del local ósea va refaccionar las puertas y las mesas. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.  

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the community bank "Sr. de Huanca de Coya", in the district of Coya, Calca province, in the administrative division of Cusco. This communal bank is made up of people who are constantly looking for opportunities to succeed, and through their daily efforts they will provide a better future for their children. The bank is organized as follows - Graciela is the president, Mario is the secretary, Rosa is the treasurer and  Cristina is the attorney.

Some of the members have businesses such as selling crafts, small animal husbandry, buying and selling cattle, raising cattle and selling food, while others provide shuttle services, or work as bricklayers and civil servants.
 
Graciela is 46 years old, married, and has three children as a result of this union. Graciela is in the food business and has a small restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and various regional dishes. She has had her business for 15 years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into it. This time, Graciela requires a loan for the maintenance of her premises and to repair the doors and tables.

The members appreciate the opportunity offered to them, and pledge to comply with the payment of their dues within the prescribed period.

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco, Cusco department, in the heart of the ancient city of the Incas. It is known as a tourist area due to its archaeological sites in the historic center, for its landscapes and for being a lovely city in the Southern Region of the country. Cusco is known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, "Machupicchu".

loans.use: to carry out maintenance of the restaurant premises, and repair the doors and tables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un taxi donde trabaja en las diferentes calles,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es mejorar el servicio de taxi.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos y llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still devoted to his transportation business. He has a taxi and works in different locations, from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Through his work he is able to raise his children, and his dream is to improve his taxi service. He is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts and tires for his vehicle.

He is very happy to be receiving a loan and agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis se dedica a la actividad comercial  desde hace 19 años; con ello ha logrado sostener su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 16 a 18 años. En su actividad diaria vende bolsos, maletines, gorros, variedades, monturas y lentes. Luis aprovecha muy bien épocas especiales para diversificar sus productos, por eso cuando se acercan días de las madres, del padre, del maestro, del niño etc. compra mercancía ajustada a los requerimientos de cada temporada y logra sus mejores ventas. En sus inicios trabajaba para una empresa como empleado, pero con el fin de generar ingresos adicionales, decidió dedicarse simultáneamente al comercio y hoy está ubicado en un local comercial al sur de la ciudad, donde trabaja dese las 8:00 am a 10:00 pm; aunque  su competencia es alta se sostiene con precios, servicio oportuno y buen trato. Su meta es fortalecer cada vez más su negocio y dejarles a sus hijos un gran legado de trabajo y emprendimiento. Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo para lograrlo en tiempos mas cortos, por eso acude a un credikiva con el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado, bolsos, maletines, carteras accesorios femeninos y masculinos, con los cuales responder a su clientela con pedidos solicitados y también Luis podrá tener un inventario, que haga su oferta muy atractiva para que sus clientes compren, con motivo de la celebración del día del padre y todas las festividades  que se acercan en periodos vacacionales del semestre, en los cuales los clientes tienen en sus manos bonificaciones y primas de trabajo, lo que haría que su inversión sea muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Luis has had his business for 19 years, and has thus been able to support his family, consisting of his wife and their three children ages 16 to 18. He sells handbags, briefcases, hats, frames, lenses and a varied merchandise. Luis takes advantage of special holidays and seasons to diversify his products, so when mothers day, parents day, teachers day, childrens day etc. are approaching, he purchases goods which match the requirements of  the season to achieved the best sales. 

In his early days he worked for a company, but in order to generate additional income he decided to simultaneously start trading and now has his own shop south of the city. Luis works from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 pm, and even though competition is high, he survives through his prices, timely service and friendly treatment of customers. 

His goal is to strengthen and grow his business, and to leave his children with a legacy of work and entrepreneurship. Luis' biggest challenge is the lack of working capital to do this in the short term, so he has applied for a loan with which he will buy handbags, briefcases, and accessories for women and men in bulk and with cash, so that he can respond to his customers' orders and maintain an inventory. He will make his products attractive for his customers to buy, to celebrate father's Day and all the holiday festivities that come each semester when customers have received work bonuses and premiums, which would make his investment very successful.

loans.use: to purchase handbags, breifcases and accessories for men and women, wholesale and in cash.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Don francisco tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos al cuidado de su abuela, está viviendo en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Francisco, estuvo un tiempo trabajando para una empresa privada, luego de quedar sin empleo decidió dedicarse al comercio, hace 10 años que realiza esta actividad en forma ambulante. El sale a vender mercadería a domicilio y también vende en su casa en una pequeña pulpería. Los productos que vende son pan, juguitos en bolsa, ristras de condimentos, huevos, sal, frijoles licuados y también un poco de ropa usada. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos de donde mantiene a su familia. Para surtir el negocio de pulpería y vender más productos comestibles como juguitos, pan y frijoles licuados está solicitando un préstamo de 10,000.00 Lempiras, este es su sexto préstamo solicitado los que le han ayudado a mantener y crecer el negocio. Todo el esfuerzo que hace es con el fin de crecer en el negocio y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Don Francisco is 47 years old, single, and has two children who are being cared for by their grandmother. He lives in the suburban subdivision of San Pedro Sula.

At one time, Francisco was working for a private company but he later lost his job. He decided to enter the retail trade and has now worked as a traveling merchant for 10 years. He leaves to make home deliveries of merchandise, but he also sells from his house where he has a small grocery store. The products he sells include bread, juices in bags, packets of condiments, eggs, salt, pureed beans, and some used clothing. This business is a strong source of income by which he is able to sustain his family.

In order to restock his grocery business, Francisco is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL since he plans to sell more food products such as juices, bread, and pureed beans. This is the sixth loan he has requested, which will help maintain and grow his business. All of his efforts are geared toward growing his business and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto tiene la edad  56 de  años, está casado, actualmente vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El con el con crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abono y  herbicidas para mantener su cultivo en condiciones regulares.  El cuenta con el terreno de café ya sembrado y está en condiciones regulares después de esta cosecha pasada, el quiere asistirlo para mejorar la florea de su plantación y darle más fuerza a sus plantas para así tener un mejor rendimiento de cosecha esta próxima cosecha. El tienen como meta aumentar su producción y generar más divisas económicas para mejora su estabilidad económica y bienestar familiar.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alberto is 56 years old and married. He currently lives with his three children and his wife, who are his greatest priorities. He intends to use this loan to buy supplies, such as compost and herbicides, for maintaining his crops under normal conditions. Alberto has land that has already been planted with coffee and is experiencing normal conditions after the previous harvest. His goal is to increase production and generate more monetary exchanges so that he can improve his financial stability and his family's well-being.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Alberto has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for maintaining his coffee crop.

loans.name: Percy Alberto

texts.es:
Percy es un joven de 30 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres los cuales se dedica a la agricultura y el los apoya mucho con su trabajo. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de maíz, algodón, entre otros. Percy es muy entusiasta, estudio gastronomía ya que le encanta cocinar,  estuvo trabajando en un restaurante y poco a poco fue ahorrando y logro compro una mototaxi, en la cual trabaja actualmente, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismático y sobre todo respetuoso con los clientes.

Percy está muy agradecido con los clientes ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una mototaxi, con esta mejora el podrá tener otro vehículo y mejorara sus ingresos y mejorara su calidad de vida, así el seguirá esforzándose por hacer realidad su más grande sueño” Terminar de construir su casa y tener un restaurante”.
texts.en:
Percy is a young man who is 30 years of age. He lives with his parents, who engage in agriculture and also receive a great deal of support from his work. Their home is located in the city of Imperial, which is known for its agriculture, specifically crops such as corn, cotton, and other commodities. Percy is very enthusiastic and is studying gastronomy since he enjoys cooking. He had worked at a restaurant and gradually saved up money so that he could buy a motorcycle taxi, which is what he uses now for his work. He works at his business approximately 10 hours a day and is able to serve up to 20 customers in a day. Percy believes he is doing well in his business because he is very charismatic and, above all, respectful of his customers.

Percy is grateful to his customers. Thanks to the assistance that has been provided, he will be able to buy a motorcycle taxi. This will enable him to have another vehicle by which he can improve his income and his quality of life. Percy continues to strive toward fulfilling his greatest dream of finishing the construction of his house and opening a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. La socia continua trabajando con su negocio de venta de comida ella vende de forma ambulatoria por el centro de la ciudad,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia trabaja todos los dias en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia desea poder continuar trabajando en su negocio y continuar apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz.
    

La socia está agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Madres Trabajadoras [Working Mothers] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is within the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Benedicta. She continues working in her food sales business; she is a street vendor in the center of the city. The member is a responsible and hard-working person. She works every day in her business, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. The member wishes to be able to continue working in her business and to continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies for her business, like rice.

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her business, like rice.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
L socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de cosmetologa ella tiene un salon de belleza,la socia hace ondulaciones,tintes de cabello y cortes,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de salon de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ruleros,tijeras y tintes para el cabello.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana still works in her cosmetology business, and has a beauty salon where she does perms, colors hair and performs haircuts. She works from 9am until 7pm, and uses this business to help her children get ahead in life. Her dream is to expand and improve her beauty salon business. She plans to use this loan to buy rollers, scissors and hair coloring.


Juana is happy to receive a loan, and promises to meet all her repayment installments.

loans.use: To buy rollers, scissors and hair coloring.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.es:
Pepe tiene 61 años, es un hombre que siempre está en actividad y pendiente de sus responsabilidades. Junto a su pareja tienen cuatro hijos que ya son mayores y viven con sus propias familias. Él y su esposa viven en su casa propia con tres nietos a quienes cuida.
Pepe se dedica a la siembra de productos regionales como “ají charapita” (un tipo ají típico de la zona). Además tiene un pequeño puesto en su casa donde vende gasolina, del que se encarga su pareja, que también ofrece comida, hielo y bebidas. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque tiene tiempo para poder hacer todas sus actividades y estar a lado de sus nietos. Tiene buenos clientes que están a la espera que salga de su chacra semanalmente para venderles sus productos. Para el futuro, espera mantener el ritmo que tiene, ya que es muy bueno para obtener los ingresos para su hogar.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Está muy comprometido en pagar, una vez más, las cutas a tiempo y de manera responsable. Se siente muy cómodo en su banco comunal, ya que sus compañeros de grupo son muy responsables y siempre se solidarizan con los demás.
Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles, comprará granos para sembrar y productos para la venta en su casa.
texts.en:
Pepe, 61, is a man who is always active and taking care of his responsibilities.  He and his wife, who have four grown children living independently, live in their own house with three grandchildren who they care for.

Pepe grows regional produce such as "ají charapita" ( a local type of chili pepper).  He also has a small stall at home where his wife sells gasoline, and also offers meals, ice and beverages.  He likes his work because he has time for all of his activities and can be near his grandchildren.  He has good customers who are always waiting weekly for him to sell them his crops.  In the future he hopes to maintain the rhythm he has because it is good for earning an income for the household.

This is his sixth loan through MFP, so he hopes to be able to continue with his goals.  He is committed to paying it back on time, responsibly, once again.  He is very comfortable in his communal bank because the members of the group are all very responsible and supportive of each other.

He plans to use the 2,500 PEN loan to buy seeds to sow and products to sell from home.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin tiene 69 años de edad pero tiene una vitalidad y una alegría de un joven de 15 según nos comenta y es porque para él si se deja ganar por el mal humor no va a trabajar bien y sobre todo no podrá estar bien para su familia, vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y sobre todo su amiga y el hombro en el cual él se puede recostar cuando necesita de un apoyo; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, esta se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso en cualquier época del año, y se le denomina la tierra del sol eterno,  se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros. El tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser ingeniero agrónomo.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo el deseo de Salir adelante Benjamin trabaja en su parcela en la cual cosecha pecanas y mangos; el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día, sobre todo porque siempre vela porque a sus plantas le de ninguna plaga para que su cosecha sea buena; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y muy conocido por los clientes.

Benjamin está muy feliz y agradecido por la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar insumos, fertilizantes y abono para su plantas y así poder mejorar la cosecha para el otro año y mejorar su ingreso, de esta manera el podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material Noble”.
texts.en:
Benjamin, 69, has a lot of vitality and the happiness of a 15-year-old.  He says that if he lets his bad mood take over he will not work well, nor get along with his family.  He lives with his wife, who is his friend and the shoulder he leans on when he needs help.  His house is located in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm climate throughout the year, and therefore called land of the eternal sun.  He works in agriculture, especially growing grapes, asparagus, and paprika, among other crops.  He has a high school education but would have liked to study agricultural engineering.

With much effort, especially because he wants to get ahead, Benjamin works on his patch of land growing pecans and mangos.  He works about ten hours a day, making sure his crops are free from disease to have a good harvest.  He believes business is going so well because he is very dedicated and knows his customers well.

Benjamin is content and grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they are giving him.  He will be able to buy supplies and fertilizers for his plants, which will make for a better harvest next year and more income.  Therefore, he will be able to continue striving toward his greatest goal: "To finish building a house out of solid materials".
