The money will enable Lali to produce a quality harvest, which can be sold for a good price. The profits will be used to finance the family's daily needs, including food and other necessities.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and to purchase fertilizers and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her office.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Josefina has been in this business for seven years. Josefina earns additional income from vegetable and egg retail.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz Mary con su anterior credikiva compró una vitrina y mercancía, con la cual la surtió;  así mismo compró cervezas, víveres, azúcar y otros productos de la canasta familiar, pues actualmente tiene una tienda ubicada e casa de sus suegros, donde le está yendo muy bien. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará al por mayor,  artículos de la canasta familiar, para atender la demanda de sus clientes, porque teniendo surtido su negocio, venderá y   continuará aumentando su capital de trabajo. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Bendiciones para todos y les deseo lo mejor y que algún día me puedan ayudar a adquirir una casa”.
texts.en: Luz Mary bought a display case and merchandise with her previous Kiva loan, which helped her grow.  She also bought beer, food, sugar, and other food basket products.  She has a store located in her in-laws’ home and things are going well for her.  She is asking for a new Kiva loan so she can buy more food products to satisfy her customers’ needs.  Having an assortment allows her to sell more and increase her working capital.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is, “Blessings for all of you and I wish you the best and I hope that someday you can help me buy a house.”

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a 60 year old widow, and a mother of five children. She lives in Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Leonita used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. 

In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris works hard to support her family. She is married and has a raffia business in the Philippines. Raffia is a soft, natural, palm leaf fiber used for weaving and making baskets. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Doris requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for producing her raffia.

In the future, Doris would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her raffia.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 34 years old and married. She has one child. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Merlinda is borrowing PHP 15,500 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive con su esposa y su hija de preescolar, trabaja en una maquiladora mientras su esposa se encarga las labores del hogar y el cuidado de la pequeña hija.
En el patio trasero tiene una alberca sin acabar de construir, le hace falta muchos detalles, sobre todo el piso, pintura y acabados, algunas tuberias para el agua y los productos para el mantenimiento posterior a esto. El quiere que la familia conviva en un ambiente mas seguro y como beneficio extra un mejor ambiente familiar y en el desarrollo emocional de su hija.
Al estar lista la alberca, la piensa poner en renta y asi darles un mayor ingreso a su familia y dice que tambien la podra disfrutar su hija ya que sera la primera en usarla.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and preschool-aged daughter.  He works in an export factory and his wife cares for the home and their young daughter.

Behind his home there is an incomplete pool the needs lots of work, above all the floor, paint, finishing, and some water and drainage pipes.  He wants his family to have a more secure environment and better family environment for his daughter’s emotional development.

Once the pool is completed, he plans to rent it out and in this way gain greater income for his family.  He also says that his daughter will be able to enjoy it, as she will be the first to use it.

loans.use: to repair his pool.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is 38 years-old. She is married and has two children, age 18 and 16.  

In 2001, she established  her cow's-milk-selling business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow.  

In the future, Sani plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and  as fuel for fires. It can also be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buys a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables, fruits, vinegar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: Depuis plus de 12 ans, Balla parcours les rues de sa localité pour vendre du café qu'il sert à domicile ou dans les lieux de travail de ses clients. Il est marié et père de 5 enfants. Il vend également de denrées alimentaires dans un magasin qui est géré par un de ses cousins.Ces deux activités lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et surtout de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, Balla sollicite un pret de 450000f auprès de l'UIMCEC afin d'acheter un stock de café en poudre. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un grand magasin de vente en gros de café en poudre en centre ville.
texts.en:
For more than 12 years now, Balla has been going through the streets of his town selling coffee which he serves to people at their houses or their place of work. He is married and the father of five children. He also sells foodstuffs in a store that is managed by one of his cousins. These two activities allow him to support his family and especially to cover the school fees of his children.

In order to bolster his working capital, Balla is requesting a loan of 450,000 francs from UIMCEC to buy a stock of instant coffee. His ambition is to open a big store wholesaling instant coffee in the center of town.

loans.use: to buy a stock of instant coffee.

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr: Dame est un jeune célibataire qui gère une quincaillerie sur la route principale qui traverse sa localité.Il a en charge ses deux parents ainsi que les frais de scolarité de deux de ses frères. Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetant du ciment et du fer. Son ambition est d'élargir sa quincaillerie.
texts.en: Dame is a young single man who runs a hardware store on the main road that runs through his town. He is supporting his two parents and paying school fees for two of his brothers. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to bolster his working capital by buying cement and iron. His ambition is to enlarge his hardware store.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 30 años casado, el se dedica al servicio de odontología el es   odontólogo, tiene su consultorio dental que se encuentran en la zona Segundo Crucero  al norte de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Carlos  va a usar este préstamo  para compra de un  equipo de rayos x para equipar su consultorio dental, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la oferta de este equipo  de ocasión, el Sr. Carlos enfrenta retos en su negocio que son trasladarse a una zona más comercial y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir equipando su consultorio y así de esta manera incrementar la atención a sus clientes.
texts.en: Carlos is 30 years old and married. He makes a living as a dentist and has his dentist practice in the Segundo Crucero area in the north part of La Paz. This is Carlos's second loan cycle with this institution, which he will use to buy X-ray equipment to equip his practice. Carlos is requesting this loan to bid on this used equipment. Carlos is faced with challenges in his business, such as moving to a more commercial area. He is going to use the profits to continue equipping his practice and this way, he will increase attention from his customers.

loans.use: to buy X-ray equipment.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 40 years-old. She is married and has two children, age 16 and 9.  

In 2000, she established  her cow's-milk-selling business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow.  

In the future, Kamala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for there milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires. It can also be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 63 years old and married. She has six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucresia has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from raising ducks and farming rice.

Lucresia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Federita

texts.en:
Federita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Federita has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Federita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Baboucar

texts.fr: Baboucar est un gardien d'un grand immeuble qui appartient à un immigré. Il exerce en même temps un commerce de produits alimentaire. Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des sacs d'oignons.Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: Baboucar works as a guard in a big building that belongs to an immigrant. He also runs a little grocery store. He is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs to buy sacks of onions. His ambition is to get into raising cattle.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Aguas Subterráneas” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de la elaboración de empanadas, completos, pizza, servicios entre otros, desde hace 2 años.
Cecilia se desempeña en sus labores en su casa de lunes a viernes y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que a veces ella es quien se dirige a los domicilios particulares de sus clientes.
Su mercadería la compra en Valparaíso en diferentes distribuidoras.
Una de las metas de Cecilia es colocar un restaurante, en el cual pueda atender a sus clientes de mejor calidad.
Con el crédito comprará materiales para su negocio, y la vez arreglar el techo de su casa.
Cecilia vive junto a su marido y 2 hijos de 11 y 5 años quienes estudian, sus sueños a nivel personal son tener una casa linda con un buen techo, y un auto para repartir sus pedidos a su clientela.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedores del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the Aguas Subterráeas communal bank in the city of Viña del Mar.

She has been making and selling empanadas, hot dogs, pizza, and others for two years.  She does her work at home from Monday through Friday.  Her schedule for distribution is in accordance with her availability.  At times she is the one who goes to her customers’ houses.  She buys her merchandise from different distributors in Valparaíso.

One of Cecilia’s goals is to set up a restaurant where she could give better service to her customers.

She will use the loan to buy materials for her business.  She will also repair the roof of her house.  Cecilia lives with her husband and two children, ages 11 and 5.  The children go to school.  Her goals on a personal level are to have a nice house with a good roof and a car to deliver orders to her customers.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her because it has allowed her to invest in her business.  Also, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank.  They share activities and interests, which have been opportunities to pass the time pleasantly.

Viña del Mar is a city and municipality on the central Chilean coast. It is known as 'The Garden City' owing to the gardens and courtyards that some of the old houses in the city have. It is also considered the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

Her business is buying and selling crabs and shrimp in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling copras (dried coconut meat). Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her crabs and shrimp business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Thul

texts.en:
Thul is 35 years old, widowed, and has five children.  She lives in a small village in Baray district. She raises hogs and sells them for profit. She also owns a convenient shop, which is located in her house, selling grocery items there. 

Due to inadequate capital to invest in her hog-raising business, Thui is requesting her second loan from HKL for 700,000 KHR, which she will use to buy four heads of pigs to raise and sell to butchers upon maturity. The loan will help her ensure proper growth of the business. Despite the hardship of living, Thul aims to provide her children with a good education and basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell to butchers upon maturity.

loans.name: Emily Joane

texts.en:
Emily Joane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years.

Emily Joane requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like detergent, soap and other groceries to sell.

In the future, Emily Joane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like detergent, soap and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Sérigne

texts.fr: Sérigne est un jeune qui exerce dans la maçonnerie plus précisément dans le coffrage de batiments.Il loue aussi des étais, des tirants et des planches pour le coffrage.Il est père de 4 enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Afin de renforcer son matériel, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des planches et des étais. Son ambition est de faire des voyages de commerce à l'étranger pour importer des équipements modernes.
texts.en:
Sérigne is a young man who works in masonry, more specifically formwork. He also leases struts, tie beams and boards needed for formwork. He is a father of four children who all go to school. 

To replenish his supply of materials, he is seeking a loan of 500,000F to purchase boards and struts. His goal is to travel abroad on business to import modern equipment.

loans.use: to buy boards and struts for formwork.

loans.name: Mathiaco

texts.fr: Mathiaco est un enseignant qui sert dans une école privée.Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Il pratique parallèlement à l'enseignement , de l'aviculture. Il élève des poussins qu'il revend après trois mois.Cela lui permet d'améliorer ses revenus et de subvenir correctement aux besoins de sa famille.Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 200000f pour acheter 300 poussins et des aliments. Il ambitionne  de construire un grand poulailler.
texts.en:
Mathiaco is a teacher in a private school. He's married and the father of two children. In parallel to teaching, he also raises poultry, namely chicks that he resells after three months.

This enables him to improve his income and adequately meet his family's needs. He's seeking a loan of XOF 200'000 in order to buy 300 chicks and food. He ambitions to build a larger henhouse.

loans.use: to buy 300 chicks and food

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. Dolores requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en: Haide works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Haide requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment for fishing business. In the future, Haide would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 74 years old, married and has 6 children. Marieta is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Marieta has been raising pigs for 25 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 55 years old, married, and has one child who attends school.  Azucena works very hard to provide for them. Azucena sells gasoline, which she has been doing for 15 years. 

Azucena is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more gasoline.  In the future, Azucena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Chuvie

texts.en:
Chuvie is 43 years old and has 6 children. She is married and has 2 children who are in school.

Chuvie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Chuvie has been raising pigs for 24 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Chuvie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them. Delia runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Delia has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and works hard to support her family. She has a mat making business in the Philippines, which she has had for 33 years.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional materials for her business.  In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for mat weaving

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old, married, and has four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She earns additional income from selling charcoal and bananas.  

Evelyn is requesting her sixth loan from NWFT for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items to sell.  Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is 43 years old. He lives in the village of Aradeti in East Georgia with his family, including his wife, Manana, two sons (ages 18 and 16) and his retired parents. Both children go to a local school. 

Malkhaz and Manana earn an income through the family's agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Manana produces cheese and sells it in the village to local dairy retailers, who buy the products from local farmers and re-sell them in nearby towns for higher prices. 

Malkhaz grows cabbage, green beans and tomatoes on 1.5 hectares of land, which is rented. Also, he has apple and peach gardens on a family-owned, 1-hectare plot of land. 

Malkhaz works hard on the plot. Sometimes, especially in the spring season when there is much work to be done, he hires local agricultural workers for help. Malkhaz sells his harvest to local green-grocery retailers. Also, he has a tractor that is used for agricultural works on his land. He also rents the tractor to neighbor farmers for extra money. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 GEL. 

Malkhaz has requested credit so he can purchase the land he now rents. As a result, Malkhaz will have fewer expenses because he won’t have to pay the rent. Also, he will use some of the money to finance his seasonal agricultural works. Specifically, he will purchase fertilizers for fertilizing the land and treating the plants against parasites. 

In the future, Malkhaz plans to save enough money to finance his agricultural works and pay for his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase the land he now rents and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married and has four children. She is 48 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Thelma owns and operates a plot of farmland, where she plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. 

Thelma has requested a loan of 6,200 PHP to purchase farm chemicals and seedlings. Thelma has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for three years. Thelma plans to save her profits in order to have enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals and seedlings.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is married, has 4 children and he is 48 years old, residing at Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Danilo is operating a crops-raising venture, planting and harvesting mangoes for sale to earn a living. He's been 2 years in this business. Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Danilo joined GDMPC in 2007.

In the future, Danilo wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, cereals, detergents, snacks, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is married with 3 children. She is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. Helen is a farmer and cultivates corn and coconut to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years and every month she earn 4,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Helen has been a member of GDMPC for 8 years. In the future, Helen hopes to finish the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma. Yvonne

texts.en:
Ma. Yvonne is 38 years old and married.

Ma. Yvonne works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries etc.to sell in her sari-sari store.

Ma. Yvonne has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Ma. Yvonne aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries,etc.to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and married with four children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store to sell to her customers.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosalie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 52 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: 2 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité “2 de Mayo” se formo con la unión de 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que día a día luchan por darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
Liz forma parte del grupo, y comenta que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio puede ayudar a sus familiares y darles lo que necesitan para tener un estilo de vida digno. Liz se dedica a la ambulante de sabanas, frazadas, edredones y otras clases de productos. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que pese a ello le gusta lo que hace ya que es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo muy honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, edredones y demás, con lo que podrá abastecerse y seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The ‘2 de Mayo’ Group is composed of eleven women from the town of Santaní. They are heads of families who struggle each day to provide their families with better living conditions.

Liz is a member of the group. She says that with a lot of effort and hard work she can help her family and provide them with the basics for a simple life. Liz earns her living selling sheets, blankets, comforters etc. in the streets. She says that although the work is very hard and takes a lot out of her, she likes it because it’s a decent and honorable job. 

She is seeking a loan to buy stock such as sheets and comforters so she will have a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters etc.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Bella requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more pants, blouses, slippers, bags and other clothing.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Bella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more pants, blouses, slippers, bags and other clothing.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Annie has been in this business for 25 years. Annie earns more income from pig fattening.

Annie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Zaida Ximena

texts.es: La Señorita Zaida tiene 22 años y es soltera   la señorita se dedica a la venta de desayunos ella vende te cafés mates y sándwich  y otros en uno de los  mercados de la zona El Tejar,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Srta. Zaida va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de material de construcción  para refacción de su puesto y así dar una buena imagen a su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de material de construcción, La Srta. Zaida enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que tiene en el mercado  en la venta de desayuno y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo y mejora de su puesto, su deseo para su negocio es tratar de comprar otro puesto y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
22-year old Sra. Zaida is single and earns her living selling breakfast items such as coffee, herbal teas, and sandwiches at one of the markets in the El Tejar area. This will be her first loan with the institution, and she plans to use the money to buy construction materials and improve her stall so that it attracts more customers. She doesn’t have enough money of her own to buy the materials.

One of the challenges that Zaida faces is competition in the market for breakfasts. She will use the profit she makes as working capital and to make improvements to her stall. One day she hopes to buy another stall and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and make improvements to her stall

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta forma parte del Banco Comunal “Leonor Mascayano” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talcahuano.
Ella se dedica al rubro de repostería, panadería y preparar colaciones, se desempeña sola en sus labores trabajando todos los días desde su casa, desde hace 7 meses.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras que se especializan en vender productos de repostería.
Una de las metas de Marta es poder colocar un local cerca de su casa, el cual pueda seguir con su clientela. Con el crédito comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio.
Marta vive junto a 2 hijos, uno de 21 quien estudia Odontología, y el otro de 28 quien estudia contador auditor.
Sus sueños a nivel personal son brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y que su negocio siga creciendo.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la región del Biobío, al sur de Chile. Es conocida como uno de los principales puertos del país. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "cielo tronador". Posee un paisaje natural  muy atractivo, debido a la combinación de ríos, mar, planicies fértiles, vegas y los cuerpos montañosos, con una hermosa vegetación. Su economía gira en torno a su puerto, su Base Naval, y un importante barrio industrial con empresas siderúrgicas, refinería de petróleo, petroquímica, cemento, gas, etc.
texts.en:
Marta forms part of the communal bank "Leonor Mascayano" that pertains to the city of Talcahuano.  She works in making pastries, bread and snacks.  She has carried out her work alone every day from her house, since 7 months ago. She buys her merchandise from distributors that specialize in selling products for pastry making.  One of Marta's goals is to be able to put up a place near her house, in which she can continue with her clients. With the loan she will buy merchandise to supply her business.

Marta lives with two children, one who is 21 who is studying Dentistry, and the other who is 28 who is studying Accounting/Auditing.  Her dreams at a personal level are to provide her family a better quality of life, and for her business to continue growing.  She is very content and thankful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since the loan will permit her to invest in her business. Furthermore, she feels comfortable with the communal group of which she is part of,  which motivates her to continue participating in the institution. She comments moreover that the trainings given in the meetings have helped her to invest better in her business.

Talcahuano is a town and city - port of the region of Biobío, in southern Chile.  It is known as one of the principal ports of the country. Its name in Mapadungun (the Mapuche language) means "Thundering Sky". The city possesses very attractive natural scenery, due to the combination of rivers, sea, fertile plains, meadows and mountainous bodies, with beautiful vegetation. The economy revolves around the port, the naval base and an important industrial neighborhood with iron and steel companies, petroleum, petrochemical, cement and gas refineries, etc.

loans.use: she will buy merchandise to supply her business.
